ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_description_brief: Break shield on enemy; Break damage to enemy and adjacent units.
ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_description_rank_1: Break dam +1 to target. All adjacent units take Break damage
ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_description_rank_2: Break dam +2 to target. All adjacent units take Break damage
ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_description_rank_3: Break dam +3 to target. All adjacent units take Break damage
ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_pg_desc:
Smashes her shield against a single adjacent target. Target and all adjacent units, friend or foe, take Break dam from the force of the attack.

Without her shield she loses her passive ability, Shield Mastery.
ABILITY.abl_shield_smash_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: Break+1 to target
Rank 2: Break+2 to target
Rank 3: Break+3 to target
ABILITY.abl_skulk_buff_buff_verbose: The skulker is invisibly stalking a target.
ABILITY.abl_skulk_description_brief: Skulker becomes invisible and stalks a target.
ABILITY.abl_skulk_description_rank_1: Skulker becomes invisible and stalks a target
ABILITY.abl_skulker_howl_description_brief: Skulker reappears and attacks, signalling its pack mates to attack the same target.
ABILITY.abl_skulker_howl_description_rank_1: Skulker reappears and attacks, signalling its pack mates to attack the same target
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_buff_verbose: A patch of coals has been ignited and will burn until the archer's next turn.
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_description_brief: Trap an area, laying down coals which do 1 strength damage.
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_description_rank_1: Explodes in 5 tile area, leaving 2 coals. Target takes <font color='#128fff'>Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_1 </font> / <font color='#ff0000'>$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_1 strength</font>
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_description_rank_2: Explodes in 5 tile area, leaving 3 coals. Target takes <font color='#128fff'>Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_2 </font> / <font color='#ff0000'>$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_2 strength</font>
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_description_rank_3: Explodes in 5 tile area, leaving 4 coals. Target takes <font color='#128fff'>Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_3 </font> / <font color='#ff0000'>$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_3 strength</font>
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_pg_desc: The Siege Archer throws a 5-tile area of slag onto the ground which explodes immediately. Targeted tile takes the damage seen below. Adjacent units take $(ABS)SLAG_AND_BURN_SPLASH_DAM_STR strength damage. It also leaves randomly placed burning coals on unoccupied tiles. If targeting an empty tile, coals always appear on the center tile first. Walking over the burning coals causes 1 strength damage.
ABILITY.abl_slagandburn_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: Armor Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_1,
$(ABS)SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_1 strength dam + leaves up to 2 coals

Rank 2: Armor Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_2,
$(ABS)SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_2 strength dam + leaves up to 3 coals

Rank 3: Armor Break +$SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_BREAK_BONUS_3,
$(ABS)SLAG_AND_BURN_TARGET_DAM_STR_3 strength dam + leaves up to 4 coals
ABILITY.abl_stonewall_buff_verbose: The axeman blocks 3 damage from every attack.
ABILITY.abl_stonewall_description_brief: Blocks damage to strength and armor for one round.
ABILITY.abl_stonewall_pg_desc:
The Raidmaster braces for impact with his heavy shield, resisting damage from each strike for the next turn. Each hit the Raidmaster takes to either strength or armor is reduced, preventing him from taking permanent damage to either.

The Raidmaster can use Stone Wall to rush into a group of enemies and gain a forward advantage, or step in the way of a powerful
enemy to block his movement
with impunity.
ABILITY.abl_stonewall_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: resist 3 damage per hit

Rank 2: resist 5 damage per hit

Rank 3: resist 7 damage per hit
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_description_brief: Added strength and armor damage to target and adjacent enemies.
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_description_rank_1: 100% to hit, strength damage +1, 1 break to target / 1 break added to Heavy Impact
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_description_rank_2: 100% to hit, strength damage +1, 1 break to target / 1 strength, 1 break  added to Heavy Impact
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_description_rank_3: 100% to hit, strength damage +1, 1 break to target / 1 strength, 2 break  added to Heavy Impact
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_pg_desc:
The Warmaster hits even harder than an average warrior, with no chance to miss. He can wreak havoc with an additional +1 strength and also adds 1 break damage to the target, plus bonuses to heavy impact.

Sundering Impact is best used when carefully positioned to impact as many enemies around the target as possible in a single strike.
ABILITY.abl_sunderingimpact_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: +1 break to heavy impact

Rank 2: +1 strength and +1 break
to heavy impact

Rank 3: +1 strength and +2 break
to heavy impact
ABILITY.abl_taleworthtelling_buff_verbose: Skald's inspirational story makes weak, hurt fighters effective against higher STR enemies.
ABILITY.abl_taleworthtelling_description_brief: Every 2 STR enemy has over ally gives +1 STR dam.
ABILITY.abl_taleworthtelling_pg_desc:
The Skald exults his target to feats of strength and heroism. His words buff an ally for 1 round, adding 1 damage for every 2 strength the enemy is above the target ally.

The boasts have no effect if the buffed ally attacks an enemy of equal or lower strength, so picking the right target is important.
ABILITY.abl_taleworthtelling_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: range 2
Rank 2: range 4
Rank 3: range 6
ABILITY.abl_tempest_description_brief: Strike adjacent enemies in a spin attack.
ABILITY.abl_tempest_description_rank_1: Normal strength damage to 2 adjacent enemies, going clockwise from target
ABILITY.abl_tempest_description_rank_2: Normal strength damage to 3 adjacent enemies, going clockwise from target
ABILITY.abl_tempest_description_rank_3: Normal strength damage to 4 adjacent enemies, going clockwise from target
ABILITY.abl_tempest_pg_desc:
The Warhawk uses his massive weight to sweep his weapon around himself, hitting multiple adjacent targets, friend or foe, for normal strength damage.

Tempest triggers the Warhawk's passive ability, Heavy Impact, which in turn can cause a chain reaction of destruction if used in close quarters. Keeping the Warhawk out of harm's way until late in the fight will maximize his effectiveness.
ABILITY.abl_tempest_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: hits up to 2 enemies
Rank 2: hits up to 3 enemies
Rank 3: hits up to 4 enemies
ABILITY.abl_threadtheneedle_description_brief: Hits all units between the archer and the target, doing bonus armor break damage.
ABILITY.abl_threadtheneedle_pg_desc:
By selecting an enemy in a straight line up to 5 tiles, the Eagle Eye shoots through every character in the way, doing normal strength damage to each, in addition to bonus armor break and puncture damage.

Thread the Needle is one of the few abilities that can damage multiple enemies in a single shot, making it extremely powerful in the right hands. Even though it also hits allies, some abilities like the Raidmaster's Stone Wall make a good combination.
ABILITY.abl_threadtheneedle_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: +1 break damage

Rank 2: +2 break damage

Rank 3: +3 break damage
ABILITY.abl_track_buff_verbose: The invisible Landsman will ignore armor while attacking an enemy.
ABILITY.abl_track_description_brief: Become invisible next to ally. Hidden attacks ignore part of target's armor.
ABILITY.abl_track_pg_desc:
Ducking and weaving among his allies, the Tracker becomes invisible to his enemies. He waits for the right moment and finds his target's most vulnerable spot before attacking.

The effect of the invisibility disappears the instant the Tracker deals damage, so picking the correct target is critical and will change the entire balance of the battle.
ABILITY.abl_track_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: Ignore 3 armor

Rank 2: Ignore 6 armor

Rank 3: Ignore 9 armor
ABILITY.abl_trample_description_brief: Charge enemy for STR dam, then 1 STR per tile traveled. Target concussed.
ABILITY.abl_trample_pg_desc: The horseborn charges forward and tramples an enemy, then attacks from behind. The enemy suffers strength damage during the charge, is subesequently struck for 1 STR per tile the horseborn moved before the trample, and is left concussed, suffering 20% on his next attack.
ABILITY.abl_trample_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: 2 tile range

Rank 2: 3 tile range

Rank 3: 4 tile range
ABILITY.abl_trollstones_description_brief: Impassable shards on empty tile, causes 1 strength damage to adjacents.
ABILITY.abl_trollstones_pg_desc: The mender pulls up stone shards out of the ground to block the path of enemies. The shards block movement, and the force of their rise deals 1 strength damage to all adjacent tiles. The stones have 10 strength and last for 1 round before sinking back into the earth.
ABILITY.abl_trollstones_pg_ranks:
Rank 1: pull up 1 stone

Rank 2: pull up 2 stones

Rank 3: pull up 3 stones
ABILITY.pas_dredge_backoff_description_brief: Runs several tiles away from an attacker when hit.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_backoff_description_rank_1: The slinger runs several tiles away from an attacker when hit.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_depraved_description_brief: Explodes upon death and creates burn area.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_disease_strike_description_br: Enemies are diseased on contact, losing 1 strength per turn.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_disease_struck_buff_verbose: The dredge infection inflicts 1 STR damage each turn.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_distraught_description_brief: Runs away from the attacker; other hurlers retaliate immediately.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_enraged_description_brief: Now wounded, Bellower will retaliate immediately when struck.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_enraged_description_rank_1: Now wounded, Bellower will retaliate immediately when struck.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_sentinel_description_brief: When a Stonesinger is hit, all Gloomwardens focus on its attacker for a round.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_sentinel_description_rank_1: When a Stonesinger is hit, all Gloomwardens focus on its attacker for a round.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_splinter_description_brief: 3+ ARM dam to dredge causes 1 ARM dam to all adjacent dredge.
ABILITY.pas_dredge_splinter_description_rank_1: The dredge's armor cracks when taking 3 or more armor damage, causing adjacent dredge to take 1 armor damage.
ABILITY.pas_embolden_description_brief: A kill grants the spearman and adjacent allies 1 willpower.
ABILITY.pas_embolden_description_rank_1: A kill grants the spearman and adjacent allies 1 willpower.
ABILITY.pas_embolden_pg_desc: Each kill the spearman makes encourages allies to fight harder, granting 1 willpower to the spearman and any adjacent allies.
ABILITY.pas_exhausted2_buff_verbose: Exhaustion makes the hero suffer a -1 penalty to movement.
ABILITY.pas_exhausted3_buff_verbose: Exhaustion makes the hero suffer a -1 penalty to movement.
ABILITY.pas_exhausted_buff_verbose: Exhaustion makes the hero suffer a -1 penalty to movement.
ABILITY.pas_eyeless_infected_strike_description_: Infects and knocks back target. 1 STR damage per turn and spreads to adjacent allies
ABILITY.pas_free_roam_description_brief: Travel 2 spaces for every willpower spent.
ABILITY.pas_free_roam_description_rank_1: Travel 2 spaces for every willpower spent.
ABILITY.pas_free_roam_pg_desc: While moving, each willpower the horseborn spends allows her to travel two tiles instead of 1.
ABILITY.pas_frenzied_defence_description_brief: The King's allies receive additional strength each time the King takes damage
ABILITY.pas_frenzied_defence_description_rank_1: +1 strength; can go above maximum strength
ABILITY.pas_frenzy_description_brief: Attacks twice; first as directed, then a random adjacent target (friend or foe).
ABILITY.pas_frenzy_description_rank_1: Attacks twice, first striking as directed, then striking a random adjacent target (friend or foe).
ABILITY.pas_frenzy_pg_desc:
The Berserker first attacks armor or strength as directed, then does strength damage against a random adjacent target, friend or foe.

Because the second attack strikes a random target, care must be taken around allies, but if only a single target is in range, that target will always receive both attacks, guaranteeing a double strike.
ABILITY.pas_heavyimpact_description_brief: Enemies adjacent to the target take 1 strength damage.
ABILITY.pas_heavyimpact_description_rank_1: When doing a strength attack the warrior does 1 strength damage to each enemy adjacent to his target.
ABILITY.pas_heavyimpact_pg_desc:
The warrior hits so hard that any enemies standing adjacent to his target on a strength attack take 1 strength damage from the shockwave.

Hitting a large target like a Varl or Dredge who takes up four tiles can potentially cause an impact across many more victims than hitting a single-tile target such as a human.
ABILITY.pas_hitandrun_description_brief: Move an additional 3 tiles after taking an action.
ABILITY.pas_hitandrun_description_rank_1: Move an additional 3 tiles after taking an action.
ABILITY.pas_hitandrun_pg_desc:
The horseborn takes his normal movement, then can attack or take another action. Once the action is complete, he can move again up to three spaces.

No willpower may be spent on the second move.
ABILITY.pas_injury_buff_verbose: This injury penalizes the unit -${target.INJURY} STR. Resting at camp will heal the injury.
ABILITY.pas_king_defended_description_brief: Damage to King absorbed by Elite Guards, who immediately retaliate
ABILITY.pas_king_elite_guard_description_brief: Split dmg dealt to King; retaliate. Regen +2 ARM to King.
ABILITY.pas_light_step_description_rank_1: The landsman can move through allies.
ABILITY.pas_light_step_pg_desc:
The landsman uses his superior dexterity to move around bodies, allowing him to pass through, but not stop on, any allies.

Light step can help a crafty landsman get safely into position behind armored allies before going in for the strike, or escape from a dangerous position.
ABILITY.pas_puncture_description_brief: Bonus damage to targets who have lost armor if the archer has not moved.
ABILITY.pas_puncture_description_rank_1: The archer gains bonus damage equal to 1 strength for every 2 points of armor the target is missing, but only if she has not moved this turn.
ABILITY.pas_puncture_pg_desc:
By standing still, the archer is able to line up a shot that takes advantage of an enemies missing armor, doing bonus damage.

For every 2 points of armor her target has lost, the archer gains 1 additional strength to her attack, as long as she didn't move beforehand. This makes her especially deadly near the end of a fight, or against tough opponents who have lost a lot of armor.

Just remember not to move, giving the archer time to line up her shot.
ABILITY.pas_returnthefavor_description_brief: Getting hit triggers a counter attack for 1 armor damage.
ABILITY.pas_returnthefavor_description_rank_1: When hit by an adjacent enemy, the shieldbanger does a counter attack causing 1 armor damage.
ABILITY.pas_returnthefavor_pg_desc:
A character who attacks a shieldbanger loses 1 point of armor for each strike he makes.

Return the Favor triggers every time the Shieldbanger takes damage from an adjacent enemy, which can make it devastating to hit him with attacks that strike multiple times.
ABILITY.pas_ruggas_poison_description_brief: Rugga's dagger must have been coated in a poison...
ABILITY.pas_ruggas_poison_description_rank_1: Rugga's dagger must have been coated in a poison...
ABILITY.pas_shield_mastery_description_brief: Strength damage is deducted from armor first.
ABILITY.pas_shield_mastery_description_rank_1: Shield absorbs all strength damage until destroyed.
ABILITY.pas_shield_mastery_pg_desc: The Shieldmaiden's shield absorbs all strength damage until it is destroyed.
ABILITY.pas_shieldwall_description_brief: Adds 1 armor to allies and himself while adjacent to the ally.
ABILITY.pas_shieldwall_description_rank_1: The raider adds 1 armor to each adjacent ally and himself as long as he is standing next to them.
ABILITY.pas_shieldwall_pg_desc:
By standing next to an ally, the raider creates a Shield Wall, raising the armor of both himself and his ally by 1. This bonus remains until the raider is no longer adjacent to the ally.

When multiple raiders stand next to each other this effect is magnified as they grant each other their own bonus. Four raiders standing in a square formation will each gain an additional 4 armor.
ABILITY.pas_skalds_song_description_brief: +1 WIL to all allies if standing within 2 tiles of an ally who delivers a killing blow.
ABILITY.pas_skalds_song_description_rank_1: Skald adds +1 WIL to all allies if standing within one tile of an ally who delivers a killing blow.
ABILITY.pas_skalds_song_pg_desc:
Skald adds +1 Willpower to all allies if standing within one tile of an ally who delivers a killing blow.

Effective use of this will keep your Heroes from tiring in combat, so keeping the skald in range of other fighters so he can move to them quickly is key.
ABILITY.pas_skulker_chase_description_brief: The skulker can move through allies.
ABILITY.pas_snowblind_buff_verbose: A flurry of snow reduces movement and range by -1.
ABILITY.pas_swampmuck_buff_verbose: Thick swamp mud impedes movement by -1.
ABILITY.pas_thick_hide_description_brief: The bear's thick hide absorbs all strength damage until armor is depleted.

BATTLE_OBJ.abl_arc_lightning: Arc Lightning a chain of 3 or more enemies
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_arc_lightning_desc:
Arc lightning jumps diagonally from unit to unit.  With each consecutive jump, the damage increases.  Wait for your enemies to line up diagonally, and use Arc Lightning to damage a continuous chain of 3 or more enemies.

Choose your target to maximize the length of the chain -- choosing a target in the middle of a line of enemies will result in several shorter chains instead of one longer one.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_axe_throw_desc: Axe Storm lets loose one flying axe after another, until deflected. Though Armor doesn't affect the chance to hit, enemies with low Armor take more Strength damage. Hit an enemy three times using a single Axe Storm.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion: Use Champion to protect an ally from attack.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_desc: Folka's Champion ability allows her to protect all adjacent allies for a full round. For maximum effect, keep as many allies adjacent to Folka as possible. When any adjacent ally is attacked, Champion will protect them.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_tip_aoe_0: No allies are adjacent to Folka! Adjust your positioning.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_tip_aoe_1: One ally is protected by Folka's Champion.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_tip_aoe_2: Two allies are protected by Folka's Champion.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_tip_aoe_3: Three allies are protected by Folka's Champion.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_champion_tip_aoe_4: The maximum number allies are now protected!
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_cull_the_weak_desc: Cull The Weak gives you a free turn if you kill an enemy. Use it to kill three consecutive enemies.  Ensure that the enemy has been damaged sufficiently prior to using the ability.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_cull_the_weak_tip_keep_going: That's one! Keep going and Cull the Weak on a second enemy.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_cull_the_weak_tip_must_kill: Bolverk, you must Cull the Weak on enemies that can be killed in a single shot!
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_frenzy: Use Bolverk's Frenzy to kill 2 enemies with 1 attack
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_frenzy_desc: Frenzy gives you two attacks for one.  Make sure your first attack kills an enemy, and that another adjacent enemy can be killed with a single shot as well.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_frenzy_tip_friend: With careful positioning, you can avoid damaging your allies with Frenzy!
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_frenzy_tip_nokill_1: Bolverk, you must drop your first target with a single hit!
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_frenzy_tip_nokill_2: Bolverk, your second Frenzy hit must hit an enemy that can be felled in one shot.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_horn: Use the War Horn to recover willpower
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_horn_5_desc: Each time an enemy falls in battle, your War Horn gains 1 star.  When you blow the War Horn, your currently active hero recovers 1 willpower for each star in the War Horn.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_horn_desc: Each time an enemy falls in battle, your War Horn gains 1 star.  When you blow the War Horn, your currently active hero recovers 1 willpower for each star in the War Horn.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_insult_desc: Sparr's Insult knocks an enemy to the back of the initiative order.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_insult_shutdown: Prevent Bolverk from taking a turn.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_insult_shutdown_desc: Use Sparr's Insult ability, and your smaller team size, to prevent Bolverk from taking a turn.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_markprey: Use Mark Prey to have 4 allies strike an enemy
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_markprey_desc: Position your allies around the target so that 4 or more of them can strike when Rook uses Mark Prey. Remember that Archers can attack from range, and that Lancers can use their spear from 2 tiles away from their target.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_rainofarrows: Battering Ram enemy into Rain of Arrows
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_rainofarrows_desc:
Oddleif's Rain of Arrows trap is triggered when ever an enemy crosses the marked tile.

Use Iver's Battering Ram to push an enemy onto the marked tile.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_runicgale_desc: Use Zefr's Runic Gale to enhance your allies 4 times
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_taleworthtelling: Use Tale Worth Telling for a +5 damage bonus
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_taleworthtelling_desc: Tale Worth Telling allows heroes to gain a damage bonus when they have lesser strength than the targeted enemy.  For every 2 points of strength difference, the hero gains +1 damage bonus.  Tale Worth Telling stacks with other strength attack bonuses.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_threadtheneedle: Damage 2 enemies at once with Thread the Needle
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_threadtheneedle_desc:
Maneuver your enemies into a straight line and use Thread the Needle to hit 2 or more of them at once. The enemy you target will be hit, as will all units (friend or foe) between yourself and the target. Sometimes the best tactic involves collateral damage.

Note that like most archer abilities, a Puncture bonus is granted if the archer has not moved during her turn.
BATTLE_OBJ.abl_track_desc: The Tracker ability allows Dytch to hide and strike from the shadows.  Drop 3 enemies in this way.
BATTLE_OBJ.overkill: Do 10 or more strength damage in a single hit
BATTLE_OBJ.overkill_desc: Your base damage is equal to your strength minus the enemy's armor. Puncture, Tale Worth Telling, and many other stacking bonuses can be brought into play.
BATTLE_OBJ.pas_heavyimpact: Use Heavy Impact to damage 3 enemies at once
BATTLE_OBJ.pas_heavyimpact_desc: When Hakon, or any varl warrior, attacks a target, all enemies adjacent to the target also take damage.
BATTLE_OBJ.pas_puncture_desc: If your archer is stationary, and the enemy's armor is damaged, kill him.
BATTLE_OBJ.pas_shieldwall_desc: Position your Raider adjacent to an ally
BATTLE_OBJ.win_desc: Win the battle by defeating all your enemies.

ENTITY.archer_desc: Women were not accepted for a long time when it came to joining in battle. In fact, it is fair to say they were never accepted. Those women you see in war are only there because the men who protested are now lying beneath a pile of loose stones and soil, feathered with hand-made arrows.
ENTITY.axeman_desc: "Stop crying. You'll have to make the decision soon, boy. Become a farmer or fisher; hard, tedious labor for certain, but you'll never go hungry. Become a trader, maybe live in wealth when you've mastered the art of lying. Become a builder or a smith, and make the things that will bring others glory. Or carry this axe in your hand, and this shield in the other, and take what those lesser men have made for you." -A father to his son
ENTITY.axemaster_brief: A versatile skirmisher who specializes in resisting damage from enemies
ENTITY.axemaster_desc: When men surrounded his modest home and shouted for his prize, teeth and blades gleaming in the moonlight, Arnhallr slowly took up his weapon. He stood in the doorway, and simply waited. They crashed like waves against his shield and in three flashes of his axe they fell. The last man fled, screaming "Keep the damn axe!" into the night. Arnhallr sighed and returned to his fire, setting the ordinary weapon beside him. There was nothing special about that stupid axe.
ENTITY.backbiter_brief: A long-range skirmisher who excels at taking out archers and weak enemies
ENTITY.backbiter_desc: As his friends and kin fell around him, screaming, the thought that now filled young Fadr's head was to simply walk up to the miserable archers responsible and gut each and every one. And so he did. It was only after the deed was done that he even noticed the wall of battle-hardened Varl he had pushed aside to get there, their brows now furrowed in confusion as if to say "What just happened?"
ENTITY.bowmaster_brief: A veteran archer who can feather enemies at a long distance
ENTITY.bowmaster_desc: A woman named Mjoll once suffered shame and poverty at her husband's death. Desperate, she sought out an old Mender who claimed to have all the things necessary to change her fortune, save but the "head of one who has seen the world". Six years later Mjoll returned, an arrow through the eye of a legendary hawk she had shot out of the clouds with her husband's bow. Sure enough she found fame and her fortune changed.
ENTITY.champion_brief: A walking fortress who steps in to soak up damage for allies
ENTITY.ent_aleo_desc: As fearless as he is flamboyant, Aleo embodies the boldness of the heroes in the sagas he knows by heart. Though a skald by profession, his devotion to protecting his wife and children fuels this poet's sword arm.
ENTITY.ent_alette_desc: Rook's daughter, Alette, only vaguely remembers her mother, who died when she was a child. Since then, Alette spends most of her time with her father, unimpressed by the traditional roles of other girls in town. She hopes to become a hunter like her father, and in her spare time she practices archery with Oddleif, the wife of Skogr's chieftain, who has become a motherly figure to her.
ENTITY.ent_bak_desc: A hog farmer who lost his mind when he lost his wife. Hes since regained the ability to live among others, though he talks to his pig-sticker spear like a loved one.
ENTITY.ent_bersi_desc: Of all of Ludin's traveling companions, Bersi is the most likely to stand out, being a literal giant amongst men. Even Ludin seems afraid of him, which may be the primary reason he hasn't been sent away. On the rare occasion it has been whispered that the varl doesn't even work for the prince, but some other group altogether. What is well known is that he's already saved Ludin's life on more than one occasion.
ENTITY.ent_bolverk_desc: Practical and prone to violence, Bolverk leads the mercenaries - known as the Ravens - with absolute authority. His rage is a weapon; his oath is unbreakable.
ENTITY.ent_dagr_desc: Not much is known about Governor Ruggas bodyguard, including whether the man can even speak. Hes deadly with a blade and does what hes told which is exactly what keeps him employed.
ENTITY.ent_dytch_desc: Like many roamers, Dytch silently appeared in Bindal one day without explanation. He works hard and keeps to himself, but there's a history in his eyes, a reason for his awkwardness. Perhaps a past he hopes to forget.
ENTITY.ent_egil_desc: A young boy growing up in Skogr without parents, Egil spends a lot of time behind a battered metal shield, training to be a fighter. The few who know him well call him Gil.
ENTITY.ent_eirik_desc: Eirik is the guy who gets stuff done for the governor of Strand, though for a man with a heavy responsibility he seems to have an awful lot of freedom in his methods. Plenty of warring clans within Strand have tried to take him down, none have succeeded. Eventually he earned himself the nickname "The Iron Turtle".
ENTITY.ent_ekkill_desc: Run-ins with this lunatic have made you hesitate to let him fight by your side but his strength and skill almost makes it worth the risk.
ENTITY.ent_eyvind_desc: Eyvind's relationship with the Valka Juno is clearly more than that of an apprentice. He also seems battle-capable in such a powerful way that many of the clansmen keep their distance. Conversely, he unselfishly uses his mending to heal the wounded and help around camp. Despite his nervous energy, Eyvind possesses a diplomatic demeanor and an unexpected confidence.
ENTITY.ent_eyvind_s2_desc: Eyvind is the apprentice to one of the menders' inner council, Juno. He has a variety of different quirks, least of which is an uneasy nervous energy that influences everything he does. Despite this, it's hard not to feel a bit intimidated around the man, like he's holding back from... something.
ENTITY.ent_fasolt_desc: Fasolt has spent a lot of time with warriors under his command. Known for being something of a vicious commander who may have at one point been a brigand with a grudge against mankind, he's also one of the most respected for reliably getting the job done. Most recently he's been posted in Schlid, holding off the dredge. If Fasolt is anything, he's a varl loyalist.
ENTITY.ent_fasolt_s2_desc: As a varl loyalist and something of a vicious commander who may have at one point been a brigand with a grudge against mankind, Fasolt is no one humans want to meet. Most recently, he was believed to have died at the Battle of Einartoft following King Jorundr's commands. He looks like he barely lived through the worst of it.
ENTITY.ent_folka_desc: Folka's size, mind for strategy, and gall make her the unofficial second-in-command of the Ravens. As the only person alive who will challenge Bolverk's orders, the other mercenaries give her a wide berth whether she wants them to or not.
ENTITY.ent_governor_desc: The elite of the corrupted class from Boersgard. The Governor manipulated his way into power and has a force of personality which makes refusing him difficult for most.
ENTITY.ent_griss_desc: The model varl warrior, Griss doesn't have much distinction to his name and little influence on the politics of varl, but he's a warrior through and through, having fought in every great war and killed countless dredge and men alike. Dependable, when he's not shooting his mouth off.
ENTITY.ent_gudmundr_desc: The captain of Bindals guard, Gudmundr not only lives by the local laws, he lives to enforce them. His past consists of costly decisions in the name of what is right.
ENTITY.ent_gunnulf_desc: When Ubin became the varl king's tax collector he was given an entourage of bodyguards to help transport gold collected across Hraun. Gunnulf is the only one from the original group still alive, and for good reason.
ENTITY.ent_hakon_desc: Hakon is something of a legend in varl culture. When he met Vognir it was during the second great war, in which the two became known for cutting a swathe through dredge where others were struggling just to stay alive. Vognir was always the charismatic leader, but there was no question about which of the two would win in a fight.
ENTITY.ent_hogun_desc: Hogun and his brother Mogun have gotten the same question their entire lives. You don't find many twins about, and even fewer who know how to use an axe. Hogun tends to be the more level-headed of the two, which may explain why he ended up with a child and wife.
ENTITY.ent_iver_desc: When Skogr was still young, Iver wandered into the town's center, startling the settlers from Rundwall who had rarely seen a varl before. He's never said why he left varl lands to help men build a small town, but each chieftain in Skogr's family line is happy to have him. He's known Rook since the man was young, and the two formed a fast kinship.
ENTITY.ent_iver_shield_desc: When Skogr was still young, Iver wandered into the town's center, startling the settlers from Rundwall who had rarely seen a varl before. He's never said why he left varl lands to help men build a small town, but each chieftain in Skogr's family line is happy to have him. He's known Rook since the man was young, and the two formed a fast kinship.
ENTITY.ent_krumr_desc: There are not many varl older than Krumr, and not many who have had as much experience fighting the dredge. In Wyrmtoe, eager fighters would regularly come to him to learn his secrets.
ENTITY.ent_large_rock_desc: Large chunk of ice blocking the caravan's path.
ENTITY.ent_ludin_desc: Ludin is the prince of men, the first heir of a vast kingdom. Though disliked by peers and rivals on account of his high-born attitude, few question his intelligence, combat skills, or courage.
ENTITY.ent_ludin_s2_desc: Ludin is the prince of men, the first heir of a vast kingdom. Though disliked by peers and rivals on account of his high-born attitude, few question his intelligence, combat skills, or courage. Having survived many recent challenges, including the Battle of Boersgard, Ludin's thoughts on leadership are in disarray.
ENTITY.ent_mogr_desc: Mogr's an old hand in varl culture, long on the frontline of the fight against the dredge. He's had the occasional brush with leading a clan of his own, but eventually settled well into commanding Vognir's personal army of varl warriors, and is highly respected amongst them.
ENTITY.ent_mogun_desc: Mogun and his brother Hogun have gotten the same question their entire lives. You don't find many twins about, and even fewer who know how to use an axe. Mogun tends to be the sort to act first and think later. This may explain the scar, amongst other things.
ENTITY.ent_narrator_desc: Known as the Scrivener, Ubin is one of the oldest varl, and has always enjoyed recording the happenings along his route as a tax collector. In light of recent events, he ponders setting aside his quill for awhile.
ENTITY.ent_nid_desc: A mother of three, Nid comes from a life that never had to worry about things like dredge destroying her home town of Frostvellr, but has adapted better than anyone expected.
ENTITY.ent_nikels_desc: Energetic and dedicated, Nikels is a naturally gifted mender willing to help any way he can. Under the tutelage of Valka Zefr, Nikels is learning more about the world on their travels than he ever did in the Tower of Manaharr.
ENTITY.ent_oddleif_desc: The chieftain of Skogr was considered one of the luckier men in town when he wooed the beautiful daughter of a well-known fighter. These days most people consider him a lucky man for marrying someone who knows how to run a town.
ENTITY.ent_oli_desc: Between food and mead, he chooses mead; though flashy with his throwing axes, hes usually rather quiet, saying, I keep myself to myself.
ENTITY.ent_onef_desc: Some relation to Ekkill has seemingly driven this man away from Frostvellr, though he has never told you much about the exact reasons why.
ENTITY.ent_rook_desc: Rook is a skilled hunter from a long line of woodsmen who have lived in Skogr, though none of his family have survived the long, hard winters of the north. Since childhood, he has been close friends with the town's resident varl, Iver. His talents quickly landed him the position of huntmaster of Skogr, and Rook wrestles with wanting to teach his daughter, Alette, to become a self-sufficient woman while also keeping her safe from harm, something he was unable to do for his wife Aldis years ago.
ENTITY.ent_rugga_desc: The elite of the corrupted class from Boersgard. The Governor manipulated his way into power and has a force of personality that is hard for most others to say no to.
ENTITY.ent_sigbjorn_desc: Found in a drunken stupor, Sigbjorn appears to be part of a clan of questionable morales currently residing in Boersgard.
ENTITY.ent_small_rock_desc: Small chunk of ice blocking the caravan's path.
ENTITY.ent_sparr_desc: Sparr has seen more of the world than most and has more opinions on it than others. He's been with the Ravens longer than any other human which is a testament to both his physical and emotional resolve. Then again, some just think he's too old and stubborn to die.
ENTITY.ent_tryggvi_desc: Tryggvi is well known in his home town, for being the guy you hope doesn't sit next to you in the mead house, or is yelling loudly in the middle of the night or building a collection of spears far more numerous than most men would need in a lifetime. He spends a fair amount of time by himself.
ENTITY.ent_ubin_desc: Known as the Scrivener, Ubin is one of the oldest varl, and has always enjoyed recording the happenings along his route as a tax collector. In light of recent events, he ponders setting aside his quill for awhile.
ENTITY.ent_vognir_desc: The king of varl's kendr, which means Vognir is next in line to lead the varl. This comes as good news for the varl as Vognir seems to be a natural born leader.
ENTITY.ent_yrsa_desc: Not many people know much about where Yrsa came from, but ever since Ludin became old enough to train, Yrsa has been close by. Rumors used to spread about a romantic relationship between the two until Yrsa found out about them, and then suddenly they stopped. Those who have spent much time near her have described the woman as intimidating.
ENTITY.ent_yrsa_s2_desc: Not many people know much about where Yrsa came from, but ever since Ludin became old enough to train, Yrsa has been close by. Rumors used to spread about a romantic relationship between the two until Yrsa found out about them, and then suddenly they stopped. Those who have spent much time near her have described the woman as intimidating.
ENTITY.ent_zefr_desc: As a Valka, Zefr is a member of the highest order of the spellweaving menders and sworn to uphold the secrets of their sect; however, she is willing to reveal much of what she knows in order to save the lives of those in her custody.
ENTITY.grudgewielder_brief: An underdog who does extra damage to superior enemies
ENTITY.provoker_brief: A well-armored instigator who can distract enemies with taunts
ENTITY.provoker_desc: The obscenities spewn forth from Grettir's smirking face do not make his enemies magically fly into a rage. But the third time a foe suffers again to hear of Grettir's explicit romance with his daughter, he may make his first angered mistake. It is only then that Grettir's long nail slides silently into his throat, and as he gurgles his last he would hear Grettir's whisper, "Nothing personal."
ENTITY.sharpshooter_brief: An archer capable of hitting piercing several enemies with a single arrow
ENTITY.sharpshooter_desc: "Stifle that yawn, child. You think you know this story but you do not. So, with her disguise exposed, the seamstress lined up her shot. As the men in the tournament laughed and mocked her, she let it fly. It did not split her opponent's arrow in two. No, her arrow flew so hard and so fast that it went clean through the archery target, through the shoulder of a man standing far beyond and into the chest of the man behind him, who fell dead on the spot. The laughing stopped."
ENTITY.shieldbanger_desc: When the Dredge first arose and swarmed across the land like a black-armored plague, it soon became known that the sound of beating wooden shields in the distance either meant salvation, or an early death, depending on which side of the line you stood.
ENTITY.shieldmaster_brief: Punishes attackers with high armor and devastating retaliation
ENTITY.shieldmaster_desc: There was one Varl who even the Dredge recognized and feared, called Steinn. Though he was said to have never killed a single enemy, they ran at the mere sight of him. Those who witnessed the battles say as Steinn waded through their midst, shield and cudgel a vicious blur, Dredge would stumble away battered, bruised and with their fearsome black armor shattered and worthless. The warriors who followed behind found little resistance.
ENTITY.siegearcher_brief: Tosses around flaming pitch to control movement and create chaos
ENTITY.siegearcher_desc: In the first great war when men fought Varl, one of the few things that would keep the giants at bay was to light one's own town on fire in retreat. One brave woman could not bear to rebuild her home for a third time. As Varl advanced yet again, she hoisted a bag of pitch upon her hip and shouted "Fools! It's not our houses they fear!" With fire wrapped around her arrows, she sent the entire front line ablaze and running.
ENTITY.skystriker_brief: Plays mind games with enemies by creating hidden traps that stun
ENTITY.skystriker_desc: While the warriors below paced furiously in the thick fog, unable to see where the invaders had landed on the shore, a young woman climbed to the highest hill. There she flung arrow after arrow, hitting their marks before her allies could even see them advance. The enemy now routed, many laying in heaps before them, they asked her how she had performed such a feat. "Where they had come made no matter," she replied, "Only where they would be."
ENTITY.strongarm_brief: Bashes into friends or foe to send them flying across the battlefield
ENTITY.strongarm_desc: A talented but arrogant young warrior was often heard mocking fellow Varl who would "hide behind a plank". An elderly giant one day challenged him to a duel. Laughing, the warrior accepted. In his first eager rush he was smashed by the veteran's shield so hard that he flew into the air and bounced off a tree, his ribs shattered and skull cracked. As the elder walked past, he was overheard to say "You only had one weapon".
ENTITY.thrasher_brief: A well-balanced fighter who does a flurry of attacks against a single target
ENTITY.thrasher_desc: "See that one? Not the one you thought I'd pick, is it? Look carefully at his face; that's not confidence, that's a man who loathes all things and everyone so much that even his anger has fled in fear. Push his back to the wall and he won't stop swinging until everything in sight is lying in pieces and his tunic hangs heavy, soaked in blood. Want to make it out of this alive? Stay away from that one." -Klintr Turtle-back
ENTITY.var_axemaster_5_desc: With his father's metal shield always at the ready, Gil has fleshed out the role of defender. He fought valiantly from Skogr to Boersgard, defying death at almost every turn. He optimistically looks forward to arriving at the capital and starting a new life.
ENTITY.var_backbiter_1_desc: Not much is known about Governor Rugga's bodyguard, including whether the man can even speak. He's deadly with a blade and does what he's told which is exactly what keeps him employed.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_0_desc: Rook's daughter, Alette, only vaguely remembers her mother, who died when she was a child. Since then, Alette spends most of her time with her father, unimpressed by the traditional roles of other girls in town. She hopes to become a hunter like her father, and in her spare time she practices archery with Oddleif, the wife of Skogr's chieftain, who has become a motherly figure to her.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_1_desc: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddleif and the varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_2_desc: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddleif and the varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_3_desc: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddleif and the varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_4_desc: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddleif and the varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_eagleeye_5_desc: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddleif and the varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_horseborn_female_2_desc: The largest tribe of horseborn - the only tribe seen by most humans in this age - is lead by this slender, charismatic warrior. Canary - or Cainniridhe to other horseborn - is eager to learn what she can of humans, varl, dredge, and all the ways of the world as it currently stands. Whether she wants to keep it that way is anyone's guess.
ENTITY.var_horseborn_female_3_desc: Derdriu is more cautious and ready to attack than most, usually concerned with betrayal from anyone but her mate, Ro'Ech. Her family was ambushed and murdered by a previously friendly tribe, leaving her with lifelong mistrust.
ENTITY.var_horseborn_male_2_desc: A duty-bound trader dedicated to his herd, Scathach is more trusting of strangers than the majority of his kind. While most humans think of horseborn as a myth, Scathach has interacted with the kragsmen of the southern bogs often enough to temper his fear.
ENTITY.var_horseborn_male_3_desc: A fearless fighter, Ro'Ech almost never backs down from a confrontation. At ten years of age, his pride, culture, and a short average lifespan drive him toward boldness; it is the only way he will become the leader of his herd before he is too old. His mate, Derdriu, unfailingly supports and encourages him.
ENTITY.var_hunter_0_desc: Rook is a skilled hunter from a long line of woodsmen who have lived in Skogr, though none of his family have survived the long, hard winters of the north. Since childhood, he has been close friends with the town's resident varl, Iver. His talents quickly landed him the position of huntmaster of Skogr, and Rook wrestles with wanting to teach his daughter, Alette, to become a self-sufficient woman while also keeping her safe from harm, something he was unable to do for his wife Aldis years ago.
ENTITY.var_hunter_1_desc: Overcome with grief from the death of his daughter at the Battle of Boersgard, Rook - a skilled hunter and proven leader - wonders why anyone would still follow his lead. With the help of a lifelong friend, the giant varl Iver, perhaps he can change the tragic pattern of losing those who depend on him and ensure the caravan's safety on the long journey to the human capital, Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_hunter_2_desc: Overcome with grief from the death of his daughter at the Battle of Boersgard, Rook - a skilled hunter and proven leader - wonders why anyone would still follow his lead. With the help of a lifelong friend, the giant varl Iver, perhaps he can change the tragic pattern of losing those who depend on him and ensure the caravan's safety on the long journey to the human capital, Arberrang.
ENTITY.var_mender_male_0_desc: Eyvind is the apprentice to one of the menders' inner council, Juno. He seems to have a variety of different quirks, least of which is an uneasy nervous energy that seems to influence everything he does. Despite this, it's hard not to feel a bit intimidated around the man, like he's holding back from... something.
ENTITY.var_mender_male_1_desc: Eyvind's relationship with the Valka Juno is clearly more than that of an apprentice. He also seems battle-capable in such a powerful way that many of the clansmen keep their distance. Conversely, he unselfishly uses his mending to heal the wounded and help around camp. Despite his nervous energy, Eyvind possesses a diplomatic demeanor and an unexpected confidence.
ENTITY.var_mender_male_2_desc: Eyvind's relationship with the Valka Juno is clearly more than that of an apprentice. He also seems battle-capable in such a powerful way that many of the clansmen keep their distance. Conversely, he unselfishly uses his mending to heal the wounded and help around camp. Despite his nervous energy, Eyvind possesses a diplomatic demeanor and an unexpected confidence.
ENTITY.var_siegearcher_2_desc: Mysterious and dangerous are only two of the words others have used to describe Prince Ludin's bodyguard, Yrsa. Her fondness of flames keep varl away, and her intimidating stares do likewise with humans. While she admits burning things isn't always the answer, it's always her answer.
ENTITY.var_siegearcher_3_desc: Mysterious and dangerous are only two of the words others have used to describe Prince Ludin's bodyguard, Yrsa. Her fondness of flames keep varl away, and her intimidating stares do likewise with humans. While she admits burning things isn't always the answer, it's always her answer.
ENTITY.var_spearmaster_0_desc: Ludin is the prince of men, the first heir of a vast kingdom. Though disliked by peers and rivals on account of his high-born attitude, few question his intelligence, combat skills, or courage.
ENTITY.var_spearmaster_1_desc: Ludin is the prince of men, the first heir of a vast kingdom. Though disliked by peers and rivals on account of his high-born attitude, few question his intelligence, combat skills, or courage. Having survived many recent challenges, including the Battle of Boersgard, Ludin's thoughts on leadership are in disarray.
ENTITY.var_spearmaster_2_desc: Tryggvi is well known in his home town, for being the guy you hope doesn't sit next to you in the mead house, or is yelling loudly in the middle of the night or building a collection of spears far more numerous than most men would need in a lifetime. He spends a fair amount of time by himself.
ENTITY.var_thrasher_4_desc: Realizing the true danger the caravan is in, Hogun has focused more time on protecting his family of late. From a small village where he group up with his twin brother, Mogun, Boersgard did little to welcome him into the life of bigger towns. His expectations for Arberrang could not be lower.
ENTITY.var_thrasher_5_desc: No longer interested in playing it safe, Mogun finds himself at odds with the civil nature of the caravan he joined when he and his twin brother, Hogun, left their village. He feels the world is ripe for the taking by anyone bold enough to try.
ENTITY.var_warhawk_3_desc: Found in a drunken stupor, Sigbjorn appears to be part of a clan of questionable morals currently residing in Boersgard.
ENTITY.var_warhawk_4_desc: One of the original Raven Warhawks, Sigbjorn has a penchant for battle and strong drink. Though brutish in manner, he often finds himself considering his role in the world at large. After the Battle of Boersgard, many aspects of his life and career have been thrown into question.
ENTITY.var_warmaster_4_desc: As a warrior, Hakon has rarely met his match. Since Vognir's death, Hakon is the most recently named king of the varl, and finds himself in unfamiliar territory. The nuances of leadership coupled with keeping the last of his dwindling race alive prove to be much less thrilling than the destruction of foes on a battlefield.
ENTITY.wardog_brief: A vicious brute who can headbutt to make more than one attack
ENTITY.warhawk_brief: A punishing force of nature who can hit multiple enemies in a single turn
ENTITY.warhawk_desc: When Varl vie for a new leader they compete in tests of wits and strength. It was a giant named Raumr who stunned his clan and won the trials when he felled not just a tree in a single stroke, but four trees. Raumr would later discover that his enemies would fall in quite a similar way, and more easily than trees, much to their dismay.
ENTITY.warleader_brief: Alters tactics on the battlefield by moving friends up in initiative
ENTITY.warleader_desc: "Heard you'd have to lose that arm. Didn't see the archer behind the giant with the shield, did you? You know who did see her? I did. And if you listened when I told you to step back you'd still have an arm, and your mouthy partner wouldn't be eating worms right now. So if you don't piss yourself tonight and run off wailing for your mother, you do what I say next time. Or I'll tear your other arm off myself." -Olfun the Aged
ENTITY.warmaster_brief: Hits harder and stronger to create even heavier impacts
ENTITY.warmaster_desc: "Go away. Does it look like I just bought my fifth mead because I want to talk about fighting? Do I look like a training yard dummy? If you and everyone who looks like you don't stop bothering me you'll find out why I keep winning in the arena. No special training, no hidden trick or fancy footwork. Want to know the secret? Hit 'em harder than they can hit you. Now get lost." -Halmr the Unbroken
ENTITY.warrior_desc: "Are there any amongst us not made to fight and kill?" asked the younger Varl. "Did Men and Dredge not run in fear just at the sight of us?" His elder chuckled. "Maybe, pup, but I will not call you a warrior until you have crushed someone so thoroughly that his friends feel the impact."

GUI.newgame_desc_alette: Since the tragic events in Boersgard, the families of the caravan look to Alette, daughter of Rook, the former leader, to guide them. Though young, her compassion for others and ability with a bow have impressed all but the most stubborn clan leaders. Calling on her personal resolve and lifetime friendships with the archer Oddlief and the massive varl Iver, Alette must continue her father's work of seeing the caravan to the safety of the distant capital city, Arberrang.
GUI.newgame_desc_rook: Overcome with grief from the death of his daughter at the Battle of Boersgard, Rook - a skilled hunter and proven leader - wonders why anyone would still follow his lead. With the help of a lifelong friend, the giant varl Iver, perhaps he can change the tragic pattern of losing those who depend on him and ensure the caravan's safety on the long journey to the human capital, Arberrang.

GUI.s2_14_battle_arb2_00: The king's army crushes you and moves on to rout the others as you bleed out in the shadow of Arberrang.
GUI.s2_14_battle_arb2_01: Rugga's army crushes you and splinters the king's forces as you bleed out in the shadow of Arberrang.
GUI.s2_15_start_postmap_00: You beat it, champ! That's the end of the game, see?
GUI.s2_8_battle_war_ormsachasm_00: The screams of clansmen fill your ears as you lay in the dirt, fighting pain and accepting your failure.
GUI.s2_game_over_00: The darkness of the cave consumes you. Just before you die, you feel the Sundr Eyeless tear into your body from within. You will serve her plans, and fail the world.
GUI.s2_game_over_01: Hooves kick and stomp you on the ground; horseborn victory chants are the last sounds you hear. Lundar, your caravan, the world - all casualties of this failure.
GUI.s2_game_over_02: You are wrapped in the Skogr banner and pulled down into the sucking mud of the bog; a sacrifice, a warning. The caravan flounders without you.
GUI.s2_game_over_03: The crushing force of dredge prove too much for you. Lundar, your caravan, the world - all casualties of this failure.
GUI.s2_game_over_04: You fall to the frozen ground, knowing the Sundr Eyeless will use your body to further her plans...and that Bellower will once again be free.
GUI.s2_pan_to_skiff_00:
Thanks for playing this
work-in-progress first half of
<font size='+20'>Banner Saga 2!</font>
GUI.saga1_alette_guilty: I didn't want to do this.
GUI.saga1_bellower_arrowdead:
As the holder of the silver arrow falls, so does any hope of defeating Bellower.

Everything you've worked for so hard... gone in an instant.
GUI.saga1_bellower_defeat:
The last thing you see is Bellower standing above you, and you know this is the end.

Everything you've worked so hard for, gone in an instant.
GUI.saga1_bellower_gameover:
With Boersgard overrun, the last thing you remember is wondering how you would survive this one.

When a colossal dredge stands over you, his stone mace raised above his head, you realize you won't.
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip1: Steel your courage! You need only slay Bellower!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip11: He lashes out for every blow he takes!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip12: Careful! He will respond to every strike!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip13: Hurry... they are becoming hard to control...
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip2: You must break through his armor!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip4: You cannot use the arrow until there is no chance of missing!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip5: Bellower will regain his strength! Keep on him!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip6: The arrow cannot be used until his armor is broken!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip7: Keep Bellower weakened! His strength will return!
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip8: Be quick... I cannot hold them back for long...
GUI.saga1_bellower_junotip9:
Still your fear. Listen.
I will try to guide you.
GUI.saga1_btl_skogr1_1: The one with the shield wouldn't lay down.
GUI.saga1_btl_skogr1_2: The one with the shield looks like trouble.
GUI.saga1_btl_strand_mead_house_1: I was hoping for more of a fight than this.
GUI.saga1_btl_strand_mead_house_2: Look at them. It's gonna be butchery.

Click a unit to deploy them into any of the blue tiles.

GUI.saga1_cin_einartoft1: Enough, Eyvind. The bridge stands. Find some other way.
GUI.saga1_cin_einartoft2: Greetings from Wyrmtoe, Jorundr. I've brought an ally.

GUI.saga1_cin_einartoft_defeat:
It isn't long before the Stonesinger clears a path for Bellower, and Einartoft quickly falls beneath at the hands of his army.

With the varl wiped from history, the rest of the world soon follows.
GUI.saga1_cin_rook_alette_1: Where did that thing come from?
GUI.saga1_cls_ridgehorn_gameover1:
As you die, your last thoughts are of the thousands of dredge marching past Ridgehorn.

An invasion? Another war? Will history remember this moment as the beginning of the end?

You never find out.
GUI.saga1_cls_ridgehorn_gameover2:
As you fall this time you realize it's different.
It's over. Done.
Those who watch history unfold will remember you, not for your bravery, but for marking the beginning of the end.
GUI.saga1_cls_skogr_approach: I see Iver! In the training field!
GUI.saga1_start_page:
The story in The Banner Saga changes based on the choices you make.

You will occasionally switch between lead characters, witnessing the story unfold from different perspectives.
GUI.saga1_start_page2:
The gods are dead.


In their wake, man and giant survived through a tenuous
alliance, driving black
destroyers called dredge deep
into the northern wastes.


Now is an era of growth
and trade. Life goes on.


Only one thing has stopped.
The sun.

GUI.ss_tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle by clicking the Ready button, or by hitting the space bar. In Survival Mode you have 60 seconds to complete your deployment.

GUI.ss_welcome_body:
You are about to embark upon a trial of 40 battles, one after another. A timer will keep each turn moving and a hero who falls is dead. The turn order is fixed, so when you kill an enemy, two of your heroes will have back-to-back turns, but the same holds true for your enemies. 
Each victory grants Renown used to upgrade your veterans or unlock new Heroes, and enemies drop random items as loot. You only have three chances to retry after any defeat, so fight fiercely. Survive to the end and become legend.

GUI.survival_quit_battle_body: If you quit now, you will use one of your ${survival_reload_limit} battle reloads to resume. You have currently reloaded ${survival_reload_count} of ${survival_reload_limit} possible times.
GUI.survival_quit_battle_limit_body:
You have used all of your ${survival_reload_limit} battle reloads.

If you quit now, your survival run will end in failure.
GUI.survival_quit_game_body:
Are you sure you want to quit?

You will be able to resume from your last save when you return, without using one of your limited battle reloads.
GUI.survival_reload_limit_reached_body:
You have reloaded battles ${survival_reload_limit} times.

You have no battle reloads remaining.
GUI.survival_reload_limit_warning_body:
You have reloaded battles ${survival_reload_limit} times.

You have no battle reloads remaining. From here on, all battles must be completed in a single attempt.
GUI.survival_reload_warning_body:
During Survival Mode, you can reload battles a limited number of times.

You have reloaded ${survival_reload_count} of ${survival_reload_limit} possible times.

Are you sure you want to reload?
GUI.survival_score_upload: Waiting for Score Computation and Upload...
GUI.survival_tip_renown_body: Renown is gained through victory in battle.  It is used to recruit new heroes, as well as to promote veteran heroes.
GUI.survival_tip_starting_roster_body: Choose six heroes from the roster to form your starting party for this survival attempt. More heroes can be recruited later as you win battles and gain renown.
GUI.survival_victory_placeholder:
You have beaten Survival Mode!

You did it so fast that we didn't even have a chance to put in the final win screen GUI!

Stay tuned for a cool win screen in the near future.
GUI.survival_warn_assemble_body: You have chosen the heroes to begin the challenge. During the game, you will have opportunities recruit more heroes by spending Renown. Are you ready to start the game with these six heroes?
GUI.tip_assemble_order_body:
Units move in the order you place them, from left to right. This initiative order is very important when setting up strategies. 
For example, put archers after melee units so that they can stay safe behind your heavy hitters.

Drag the unit icons to rearrange their turn order.
GUI.tip_battle_deploy: During deployment, you can place your units anywhere within the blue tiles area.  You can select a unit by clicking its tile, and then deploy it by clicking on an empty blue tile.
GUI.tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle by clicking the Ready button, or by hitting the space bar.
GUI.tip_battle_horn:
The Battle Horn fills with stars as you defeat enemies.
Click this button to blow the horn and regenerate one Willpower for the active unit.
GUI.tip_battle_horn_full:
The Battle Horn is full of stars, and can hold no more.
Be sure to use the horn before you defeat another enemy.
GUI.tip_battle_morale_1:
Poor Caravan Morale causes a -2 Willpower penalty in battle.
Maintain sufficient supplies and rest in camp improve morale.
GUI.tip_battle_morale_2:
Weak Caravan Morale causes a -1 Willpower penalty in battle.
Maintain sufficient supplies and rest in camp to improve morale.
GUI.tip_battle_morale_3:
Normal Caravan Morale does not affect your heroes' Willpower in battle.
Maintain sufficient supplies and rest in camp to improve morale.
GUI.tip_battle_morale_4:
Good Caravan Morale causes a +1 Willpower bonus in battle.
Maintain sufficient supplies and rest in camp to improve morale.
GUI.tip_battle_morale_5:
Great Caravan Morale causes a +2 Willpower bonus in battle.
Your great leadership has allowed for ample supplies and caravan rest.
GUI.tip_battle_unit_exhausted: This unit is out of willpower.  Willpower is required for using abilities, moving extra distance, hitting extra hard. You can recover your Willpower by using the Horn or resting on your turn.
GUI.tip_battle_unit_hazard: This is a hazard. To avoid it you can carefully plan your movement by clicking waypoints, tile by tile, before confirming your move.
GUI.tip_battle_unit_injury:
This unit is injured, causing a Strength penalty.
After the battle, rest in camp or town to heal.
You can hover over the Strength display for more information.
GUI.tip_battle_unit_morale:
The unit's Willpower is modified by caravan morale, and displayed here.
You can hover over the Willpower display for more information.
GUI.tip_camp_injury:
A red skull icon shows that some of your units are injured. Use the Rest tent to pass time and heal.
Full recovery may take several days.
GUI.tip_camp_upgrades:
Some of your units are ready to be promoted or improved.
Use the Heroes tent to upgrade them.
GUI.tip_roster_injured_body: One or more of your units is injured. Injured units can still fight but have a penalty to max strength equal to the number of days wounded. They heal as time passes when resting in camp.
GUI.tip_roster_items_body:
Your items are shown at the bottom of the Roster.
Drag items onto your units to equip them.
Items can only be equipped by characters of equal rank; promote your units to equip higher rank items. Click on an item for more information.
GUI.tip_roster_survival_dead_body: One or more of your heroes has been killed. Killed units are shown at the bottom of your roster.
GUI.tip_travel_injury: Some of our heroes are injured, and need to rest in camp.
GUI.tournament_ended_msg:
has Emerged Victorious in the Tournament!
Skalds songs echo through the fjords...
GUI.tournament_winner_1_msg_:
You are Victorious in the Tournament!
Skalds songs echo through the fjords...
GUI.tournament_winner_2_msg_:
Your Renown Grows!
Skalds songs echo through the fjords...
GUI.tournament_winner_3_msg_:
Your Renown Grows!
Skalds songs echo through the fjords...
GUI.trig_low_morale_speak: We should rest in camp to recover morale.
GUI.trny_desc:
Clans battle across the city putting the
renown of their family name on the line.
To the winner goes the glory!
GUI.trny_incorrect_party_power_body: You need party of $POWER power to join. Please adjust your party in the proving grounds.
GUI.tt_battle_injury: $AMOUNT due to injury.  Rest in camp to recover.
GUI.unit_name_subtext: Choose the name by which this character will be known in battle.
GUI.variations_explanation: Purchasing color variations will permanently unlock them across all current and future characters with no renown costs.
GUI.vs_not_enough_party_members_body:
You need 6 party members to play.
Please add more in the proving grounds.
GUI.vs_party_exceeds_limits_body:
Your party exceeds the %s limit.
Please reform your party in the proving grounds.
GUI.vs_searching_quickmatch:
The search expands over time to find the next closest match.
Battling higher power teams awards bonus renown, be brave!
Courage will earn you full renown in the face of surrender,
and your opponent will keep nothing but cowardly shame!
Quickmatch battles are not recorded in the Hall of Valor.
GUI.vs_searching_ranked:
The results of your battle will be recorded in the Hall of Valor!
Courage will earn you full renown in the face of surrender,
and your opponent will keep nothing but cowardly shame!
GUI.vs_searching_title: Searching for a match at your teams power level
GUI.vs_searching_tourney:
The search finds the closest battle by matching Ranking.
The results of your battle will be recorded in the Hall of Valor!
Courage will earn you full renown in the face of surrender,
and your opponent will keep nothing but cowardly shame!
GUI.war_risk_100: You immediately realize your mistake in not training more fighters. The enemy completely outnumbers you, but you bolster your courage, knowing your clansmen's lives are at stake.
GUI.war_risk_20:
The enemy looks completely unprepared for the size of the army you trained.
With this many fighters, a victory will ensure all your clansmen will be safe and your renown and morale will flourish.
GUI.war_risk_40:
Barring any surprises, you should have the advantage based on the sizeable force you trained.
Your fighters will be able to protect almost all of your clansmen, should you win, and your renown and morale will grow.
GUI.war_risk_60: It looks like the force you trained is roughly the size of the enemy's. This could go either way, but a victory here will protect most of your clansmen.
GUI.war_risk_80: There are more of them than trained fighters with you, but smart tactics could still win this fight! Many of your clansmen will die unless you are victorious.

GUI_GP.battle_q_info: <font color='#77C1FF'>Information Panel</font>: using <<GP.D_LRD>>, select a unit in the initiative bar to see their passive ability (in gold) and their active ability (in purple). Their buffs and debuffs can also be viewed here.
GUI_GP.battle_q_pan: Use the <<GP.RSTICK>> to look around the scene.  Zoom by holding down <<GP.R3>>.
GUI_GP.heroes_ready_no_party_body:
You have not assigned any heroes to your battle party.  You must select at least 1 hero to go into battle.

After dismissing this dialog press <<GP.MENU>> for more information.
GUI_GP.pg_q_click_points_saga: Use <<GP.DPAD>> to access the + and - buttons to add and remove points.
GUI_GP.pg_q_items: <font color='#FEDAB0'>Items</font> can be equipped onto your heroes.  Press <<GP.Y>> to inspect and equip items.
GUI_GP.pg_q_lore:
<font color='#5DC0FF'>Lore</font> is where you go to learn more about this
character. Use <<GP.DPAD>> to select it.
GUI_GP.pg_q_roster:
This is the <font color='#70C9FF'>Roster</font> showing all units available for assignment to the <font color='#90CDFF'>Party</font> slots above.

Use <<GP.DPAD>> to select, inspect, or move a unit.
GUI_GP.pg_q_roster_ass:
This is the <font color='#70C9FF'>Roster</font> showing all units available for assignment to the <font color='#90CDFF'>Party</font> slots above.

Use <<GP.DPAD>> to select, then <<GP.A>> to inspect or <<GP.X>> to move a unit. When ready for battle, use <<GP.DPAD>> to select the <font color='#90CDFF'>Ready</font> button.
GUI_GP.pg_q_stat_ability:
<font color='#D39BFF'>Ability</font> is the unique power that this class wields.
Use <<GP.DPAD>> to select the icon for more information.
GUI_GP.saga1_btl_strand_mead_house_tip:
Select a unit with <<GP.D_LR>> and use <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to deploy them into any of the blue tiles.
When all units are satisfactorily deployed, press <<GP.Y>> to start the battle.
GUI_GP.saga1_vlg_strand_click_marketplace:
Use <<GP.LSTICK>> or <<GP.L1>> and <<GP.R1>> to highlight the Market Tent,
then press <<GP.A>> to visit the merchant.
GUI_GP.saga1_vlg_strand_click_talk:
Use <<GP.LSTICK>> or <<GP.L1>> and <<GP.R1>> to highlight a Talk icon,
then press <<GP.A>> to converse with the hero.
GUI_GP.saga1_wld_ridgehorn_click_heroes: Select the Heroes Tent using <<GP.L1>> or <<GP.R1>>, then press <<GP.A>>
GUI_GP.ss_tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle with <<GP.Y>>. In Survival Mode you have 60 seconds to complete your deployment.
GUI_GP.tip_assemble_order_body:
Units move in the order you place them, from left to right. This initiative order is very important when setting up strategies.
For example, put archers after melee units so that they can stay safe behind your heavy hitters.

Select units with <<GP.DPAD>> and <<GP.X>> to rearrange their turn order.
GUI_GP.tip_battle_deploy: During deployment, you can place your units anywhere within the blue tiles area.  You can select a unit with <<GP.D_LR>>, and then deploy onto an empty blue tile with <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>>.
GUI_GP.tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle with <<GP.Y>>.
GUI_GP.tip_battle_horn:
The Battle Horn fills with stars as you defeat enemies.
Press <<GP.Y>> to blow the horn and regenerate one Willpower for the active unit
GUI_GP.tip_battle_unit_hazard: This is a hazard. To avoid it you can carefully plan your movement by setting waypoint tiles with <<GP.X>> before confirming your move.
GUI_GP.tip_battle_unit_injury:
This unit is injured, causing a strength penalty.
After the battle, rest in camp or town to heal.
GUI_GP.tip_battle_unit_morale: The unit's Willpower is modified by caravan morale, and displayed here.
GUI_GP.tip_roster_items_body:
Your items are shown at the bottom of the Roster.
Press <<GP.Y>> to equip them.
Items can only be equipped by characters of equal rank; promote your units to equip higher rank items. Select an item using <<GP.Y>> and <<GP.DPAD>> for more information.

GUI_MOBILE.battle_q_info: <font color='#77C1FF'>Information Panel</font> tap a unit in the initiative bar to see their passive ability (in gold) and their active ability (in purple). Their buffs and debuffs can also be viewed here.
GUI_MOBILE.battle_q_options: <font color='#E785FF'>Options</font> is where to customize your combat experience. Tap it for more information.
GUI_MOBILE.battle_q_pan:
Touch and drag anywhere on the screen to
move around the scene.
GUI_MOBILE.heroes_ready_no_party_body:
You have not assigned any heroes to your battle party.  You must select at least 1 hero to go into battle.

Tap the '?' button at the lower right for more information.
GUI_MOBILE.pg_q_click_points_saga: <font color='#FFDBB1'>Tap</font> the + and - buttons to add and remove points.
GUI_MOBILE.pg_q_items: <font color='#FEDAB0'>Items</font> can be equipped onto your heroes by dragging them into the hero portraits.  Tap on an item to see what benefits it confers.

GUI_MOBILE.pg_q_roster_ass:

Once you are ready for battle, tap the <font color='#90CDFF'>Ready</font> button.

GUI_MOBILE.saga1_vlg_strand_click_talk: Tap a Talk icon to converse with one of your heroes.
GUI_MOBILE.ss_tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle by tapping the Ready button. In Survival Mode you have 60 seconds to complete your deployment.
GUI_MOBILE.tip_battle_deploy: During deployment, you can place your units anywhere within the blue tiles area.  You can select a unit by tapping it, and then deploy onto an empty blue tile by tapping the tile.
GUI_MOBILE.tip_battle_deploy_ready: Once all of your units are satisfactorily deployed, you can enter battle by tapping the Ready button.

GUI_MOBILE.tip_battle_unit_hazard: This is a hazard. To avoid it you can carefully plan your movement by tapping waypoints, tile by tile, before confirming your move.

This unit is injured, causing a Strength penalty.
After the battle, rest in camp or town to heal.

GUI_MOBILE.tip_battle_unit_morale:
The unit's Willpower is modified by caravan morale, and displayed here.
