SPEAK.s2_10_iver_speaks_iver_00: Looks like dredge are hitting the town too.
SPEAK.s2_10_juno_speak1_landscape.characters.j: I've been here before...but not like this.
SPEAK.s2_10_serpent_speak2_landscape.character: How is it you remain alive while inside me?
SPEAK.s2_10_speak_aleo_aleo_00: Even now, the petrified flames ward off our varl friends.
SPEAK.s2_10_speak_juno0_landscape.characters.j: An ancient tongue. I...know the language.
SPEAK.s2_10_speak_juno3_landscape.characters.j: I'm...I'm no longer sure I can die.
SPEAK.s2_11_bolverk_speak_bolverk_00: What in the depths am I looking at, Valka?
SPEAK.s2_11_eyeless_ending_speak_00: What in the depths is happening?
SPEAK.s2_11_eyeless_intro_speak_01: She is the Sundr Eyeless and can raise the fallen! Destroy her!
SPEAK.s2_11_sigbjorn_speak_sigbjorn_00: Gods, I almost forgot how nice it is to not always have the blinding sun up above!
SPEAK.s2_11_sparr_speak_sparr_00: What are we looking at, Valka? The center of the world?
SPEAK.s2_11_zefr_speak_zefr_00: For the others' sake, it's best we not discuss it.
SPEAK.s2_13_fingernail_bolverk_00: They won't live to learn their mistake!
SPEAK.s2_13_fingernail_prisoner_00: Give us your food and your weapons!
SPEAK.s2_13_oldford_intro_00: Is that Nikels? But he's dead!
SPEAK.s2_13_oldford_intro_01: Don't be fooled. That isn't Nikels, but Eyeless!
SPEAK.s2_13_speak_dredge_folka_00: Dredge are pouring over those hills like ants!
SPEAK.s2_13_zefr_speak_zefr_00: These people will...help us. Don't...attack them.
SPEAK.s2_14_king_gate_speak_00: Starting to feel weak... Did Rugga poison me?
SPEAK.s2_14_king_tent_speak_00: Just a flesh wound...though I feel...odd...
SPEAK.s2_14_king_tent_speak_01: Depths take Rugga! Rally the troops!
SPEAK.s2_14_king_tent_speak_02: To the gate! Back to the gate!
SPEAK.s2_14_king_tent_speak_03: Feeling strange... That wound Rugga gave me...
SPEAK.s2_15_bolverk_speak_00: For all of my people who fell to your schemes, you will pay!
SPEAK.s2_15_bolverk_speak_01: Raze and thousands of others will be avenged!
SPEAK.s2_15_iver_speak_01: Bellower? Seems I'll get payback for my arm after all!
SPEAK.s2_15_juno_speak_00: I sense another mind within Bolverk!
SPEAK.s2_15_juno_speak_01: Zefr is under my control, but I think Bolverk is possessed by Bellower!
SPEAK.s2_15_juno_speak_02: Eyvind is losing control! Watch out for lightning!
SPEAK.s2_15_juno_speak_03: Ride Zefr's wind! A lightning strike might free Bolverks' mind!
SPEAK.s2_8_cls_ormsa_speak_oddleif_00: Whatever caused that chasm completely destroyed this place.
SPEAK.s2_8_cls_ormsdalr_hakon_hakon_00: Looks like a few buildings might've made it.
SPEAK.s2_9_battle_oli_speak_00: Careful! One of those slingers is getting ready to hurl a slab of rock!
SPEAK.s2_aleo_speak_aleo_00: She's even more beautiful than the songs say.
SPEAK.s2_aleo_talk1_aleo_00: There we were...surrounded by mud men, when suddenly our leader revealed a brilliant plan!
SPEAK.s2_aleo_talk2_aleo_00: You DO have a brilliant plan, right? Someone? Anyone?
SPEAK.s2_auto_bolverk_00: Straight to the faen depths with this unending snowstorm!
SPEAK.s2_auto_bolverk_02: Finish this mess and get back to the others!
SPEAK.s2_auto_folka_00: What is that gloomy thing standing watch over those stonesingers?
SPEAK.s2_auto_folka_01: A couple of those skulkers are alarmingly large and vile!
SPEAK.s2_auto_landscape.bolverk_talk1_00: We will have our vengeance for your deceit!
SPEAK.s2_auto_landscape.juno_talk1_00: It did not need to come to this!
SPEAK.s2_auto_setup_camera_00: I said this would happen, didn't I?
SPEAK.s2_auto_sparr_00: Probably that paunch of yours rumbling again.
SPEAK.s2_auto_sparr_01: Killing these slags never gets old! <cough>
SPEAK.s2_auto_talk_eyvind_00: Hush, Juno. You're safe now. I'll always keep you safe.
SPEAK.s2_auto_talk_hero_00: Eyvind, what did you - how did you do this?
SPEAK.s2_auto_talk_iver_00: Save your questions. We should get away from here.
SPEAK.s2_battle_check_bolverk_00: Clear these faen barricades! All of them!
SPEAK.s2_bolverk_motivational_speech_bolverk_0: Any Raven gets knocked down by this lot and he'll answer to me!
SPEAK.s2_bolverk_turn_undefinedjuno_00: Eyvind's lightning! If Bolverk is struck, it may free his mind!
SPEAK.s2_dagr_spawn_aleo_00: They'll sing songs of our triumph, eh, my silent friend?
SPEAK.s2_dagr_spawn_hero_00: There's Rugga's man...but where is Ludin?
SPEAK.s2_direguard_emerge_hero_00: That big one's their leader. I bet they all run if he falls!
SPEAK.s2_direguard_emerge_hero_01: Kill that one! It might make the others run.
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hakon_00: They should be here by now...
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_00: I hope Ludin and Rugga's man can cut off these dredge!
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_01: I hope Aleo and Rugga's man can cut off these dredge!
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_02: Keep fighting! They may seem endless, but we can beat them!
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_03: More dredge! Hold them off until Ludin arrives!
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_04: More dredge! Hold them off until Aleo arrives!
SPEAK.s2_dredge_spawn1_hero_06: Their numbers dwindle! Let's end this!
SPEAK.s2_first_landscape.king_bubble2_00: I should've killed you when I had the chance.
SPEAK.s2_friend_spawn_oddleif_00: The noises came from this way! Hurry!
SPEAK.s2_hakon_talk_hakon_00: Didn't want it to end up like this, but I won't back down now!
SPEAK.s2_hakon_talk_hero_00: I'm sorry Hakon.  I wish things could be different!
SPEAK.s2_hakon_whack_on_hero_00: Bolverk's lost his mind! Take him down!
SPEAK.s2_hakon_whack_on_oddleif_00: Here they are! Just as I said.
SPEAK.s2_hero_talk_hero_01: The king's guards are legendary.  Their lives are linked to the king's.
SPEAK.s2_hero_talk_hero_02: Yes...and their mender charms will repair the king's armor!
SPEAK.s2_juno_speak_1_undefinedjuno_00: Hold them off! This will take time.
SPEAK.s2_juno_speak_2_undefinedjuno_00: You must keep the dredge away!
SPEAK.s2_juno_speak_4_undefinedjuno_00: That should work! Clear away the dredge and we can move.
SPEAK.s2_more_arrive_gudmundr_00: Fall back! We're closing the mine!
SPEAK.s2_oddleif_fire_start_oddleif_00: I'll cover you from here, but don't expect any miracles!
SPEAK.s2_raise_rock_2_undefinedjuno_00: Almost, but we still need more time!
SPEAK.s2_raise_rock_3_undefinedjuno_00: That should work! If we can clear away the dredge, we can proceed!
SPEAK.s2_rock_check_complete_bolverk_00: The caravan can get through! Move!
SPEAK.s2_setup_battle_folka_folka_00: Stay behind your shields...if you've got one!
SPEAK.s2_setup_battle_griss_hakon_00: Griss? Why did he advance so far?
SPEAK.s2_setup_battle_griss_hero_00: Don't let his death be in vain. Fight!
SPEAK.s2_setup_bolverk_00: Stealing from the Ravens? You must have a death wish!
SPEAK.s2_setup_unavoidable1_bolverk_00: Hold these faen dredge back while the caravan gets clear!
SPEAK.s2_setup_unavoidable2_bolverk_00: We have to clear those rocks behind us!
SPEAK.s2_setup_unavoidable2_bolverk_02: If we don't clear this faen ice away, the caravan can't get through!
SPEAK.s2_setup_unavoidable2_bolverk_03: Dig! There's an endless sea of dredge coming at us!
SPEAK.s2_skulker_emission_1_oddleif_00: Watch your flank! Something skulks from the shadows.
SPEAK.s2_skulker_skulked_hero_00: Where did that faen skulker go?
SPEAK.s2_spawn_horseborn1_hero_00: More are coming! Keep them away from the town!
SPEAK.s2_spawn_horseborn1_hero_01: If we defeat enough, the rest will retreat!
SPEAK.s2_spawn_horseborn1_hero_02: This should be the last of them!  Let's finish this!
SPEAK.s2_speak1_hero_00: We fight to protect the people of Lundar!
SPEAK.s2_speak1_hero_01: Protect the supplies! Without them, the people will starve!
SPEAK.s2_speak1_hero_02: Even with their guards, the people here were still being over run!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_dredge_hero_00: Don't waste Hakon's efforts. Drive the remaining dredge back!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_dredge_hero_01: Stop the dredge from looting supplies before there's nothing left!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_dredge_hero_02: Make the dredge pay for their tireless slaughter!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_horseborn_hero_00: Stop these horseborn! The people of Lundar need our protection!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_horseborn_hero_01: Stop the horseborn from stealing supplies before there's nothing left!
SPEAK.s2_speak2_horseborn_hero_02: Those horseborn won't stop! They're slaughtering everyone!
SPEAK.s2_speak_2_egil_00: They were waiting for us. This was an ambush!
SPEAK.s2_speak_3_hero_00: Keep fighting! As soon as the boats are free and we are clear of these dredge, we'll be fine.
SPEAK.s2_speak_folka2_folka_00: I bet that scout tower already sent word of us being here.
SPEAK.s2_speak_folka_folka_00: All of these people are looking for food and a home.
SPEAK.s2_speak_now_hero_00: I have no idea what's going on.
SPEAK.s2_speak_oli_oli_00: And I'm looking for ale. Is that so much to ask for?
SPEAK.s2_speak_sparr_sparr_00: Remember the last time we saw this foul fowl, eh, Bloodaxe?
SPEAK.s2_speak_ubin_caravan.0_00: I never thought I'd live to see something like this...
SPEAK.s2_speaking_1_hero_00: Bring down Rugga's man! The rest are only dupes!
SPEAK.s2_stonesinger_arrival_zefr_00: His song stripped armor from the dredge!
SPEAK.s2_talky_talk_eirik_00: Leave the bear to me. It's all for nothing if we kill it!
SPEAK.s2_victory_denied_*player_00: There's no end to them! We have to get through those rocks!
SPEAK.s2_zefr_does_stuff_undefinedjuno_01: We must find a way to force the presence out of him!
SPEAK.s2_zefr_does_stuff_undefinedjuno_02: Zefr!  Lend Iver the wind's power!
SPEAK.s2_zefr_does_stuff_undefinedjuno_03: Again, Zefr! Iver needs the runic gale!

SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_bolverk_hakon_00: "Now stand down or you'll be missing more than your horns."
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_03: Some more fierce, more violent than others.
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_04: So few of my kind - the giant varl -
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_06: Even so, I find myself wondering if humans,
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_08: suffer more for their loss of "loved ones.
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_09: Several weeks have passed since we slew
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_11: but the chaos of the world
SUBTITLE.cin_ch08_intro_12: did not wither as we hoped.
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_arrow_01: Our intentions gone, our fates laid bare
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_arrow_02: We are forced to change, pulled in new directions
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_arrow_03: For good or ill, we cannot know
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_arrow_04: How far do the echoes of our struggles reach?
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_arrow_05: What can we expect from our efforts in this breaking world?
SUBTITLE.cin_ch15_finale_no_arrow_01: Our intentions gone, our fates laid bare

SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_00: When the sun stopped in the sky, life continued as normal.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_01: Then, the stone-armored dredge reappeared, ancient foes from the far northern reaches,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_02: and the world was thrown into chaos.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_03: Giant varl defenders were slaughtered, their strongholds destroyed.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_04: Now Hakon is the varl king, and protects who is left of his race
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_05: Rook, a humble hunter, and father of Alette,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_06: found himself leading frightened clansmen towards safety.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_07: His caravan crossed paths with Juno and Eyvind,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_08: two of the mysterious spellweavers known as menders,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_09: who know something about the massive, mountain-breaking serpent on the loose.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_10: In Boersgard, a town under the protection of the mercenary leader, Bolverk,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_11: both varl and human stood against a dredge general,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_12: the immortal Sundr known as Bellower.
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_13: Juno devised a way to stop Bellower,
SUBTITLE.saga1_recap_14: but it cost the life of one held dear.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_01_00: A small village under dredge assault.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_01_01: Without help, the villagers would be crushed,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_01_02: their pleading screams left to echo eternally.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_02_00: More dredge marched through a snow-covered copse of trees.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_03_00: Fallen trees and other debris blocked the river ahead.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_03_01: Dredge took advantage of the delay.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_04_00: Broken, busted ships and a waiting foe.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_04_01: There was no easy way out of this one.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_05_00: Backed up against a bottomless chasm.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_05_01: It was as fierce a fight as there ever was
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_05_02: when deaths the only other option.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_06_00: Bandits came for something that wasnt theirs.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_06_02: Its why they had to die.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_07_00: The middle of the woods in the middle of nowhere.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_07_01: There were no safe places left.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_08_00: Just a few homes, a few defenses.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_08_01: But the people inside seemed to hate everyone outside.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_08_02: Hate them enough to kill them.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_09_00: The hills couldnt stave off attacks
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_09_01: any more than the battle and blood could stop the snow.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_10_00: A blizzard so thick it blotted out mountains,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_10_02: but not so thick as to stop the fight.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_11_00: Pelted by rain, and feet half-swallowed by sucking mud.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_11_01: A swamp was as good a place to be ambushed as any.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_12_00: The mud wouldnt dry out because the rain wouldnt let up.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_12_02: The only way out was the hard way.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_13_00: The open field might have been considered beautiful at some point,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_13_01: but not after the carnage of war.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_14_00: Broken walls. Broken bones. Broken dreams.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_14_01: That was all that was left of that town.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_15_00: A lively market was an unfortunate battlefield.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_15_01: Shoppers turned into soldiers or died.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_16_00: When home was no longer safe, it was no longer home.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_16_01: These buildings were the newest ghost town,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_16_02: they just didnt know it yet.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_17_00: Stone walls can make great halls, and great tombs.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_17_01: It was the first time more people wanted out
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_17_02: of that place than wanted in.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_18_00: It might have been a farm before,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_18_01: but it was a burial ground soon after.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_19_00: Ice-slicked mountain passes dusted in snow.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_19_01: There was no help for anyone who couldnt help themselves.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_20_01: where the painful cold is measured by how fast tears freeze.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_20_03: but it was the only way to stay warm.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_21_00: Tunnels, dark and dank. And narrow.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_21_01: Finding a bit of elbow room, though,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_22_00: The darkness of the cave had lost its charm,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_23_00: A cavern floor riddled with crevices.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_23_02: and hardly any room to fight.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_24_01: the cave itself seemed to press in from all sides.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_24_02: The slaughter was as much for sanity as for survival.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_25_02: There was no sense in it,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_25_03: just another attempt to stay alive.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_26_00: The trees served up foe after foe
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_26_01: like they were growing them back there,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_26_02: in the shadows, just out of sight.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_27_00: A large force came from all sides.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_27_01: The branches shook and rattled overhead,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_27_02: the sound like a crowd crowing at combatants.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_28_00: White snow against a dark sky.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_28_01: Things were changing, but not the fighting;
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_28_02: it was as hard and gruesome as ever.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_29_00: A cold fog hid most of the fighting that day.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_29_01: The sights, at least, but not the sounds.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_30_01: Thoughts of peace were covered in blood
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_30_02: like the ground covered in snow.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_31_00: Attacked from the hills all around.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_31_02: enough to madden a holy man.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_32_00: Civilization was the first casualty in the chaos of war.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_32_01: And here were its snow-clad bones.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_33_00: An old bridge fighting all odds
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_33_02: There was a metaphor somewhere among the stones.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_34_00: Rationed meals, constant vigilance, and frayed hopes.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_34_01: A small village could only take so much.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_35_00: Hunting grounds in a forest clearing.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_35_01: More than the wildlife had something to fear that day.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_36_00: Even the water under the bridge
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_36_01: reflected the foulness of the fighting above.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_37_00: The merging of streams and the merging of enemies.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_37_01: Leaving these headwaters alive was a struggle.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_38_00: Even in the shade of tents and awnings,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_38_01: war was still a welcome guest.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_39_00: The fight where so many fell,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_39_01: all in the vain hope of glory.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_39_02: The walls watched as the ground turned red around them.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_40_00: Magic and madness held this stone tower together,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_btl_40_01: but it could not keep everyone alive.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_complete_00: How do great warriors become legends?
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_complete_01: Through quick decisions and unwavering courage
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_complete_02: in the face of impossible odds.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_start_00: Great warriors do not become legends by the battles they win,
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_start_01: for there are no victors on death-strewn fields.
SUBTITLE.survival_vo_start_02: Great warriors become legends by the battles they survive.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video1_00: It has been several long months on the road. The first signs of snowfall accost us on our approach to Strand, largest of the trade cities on the varl-human borders, and our last collection before returning to the capital.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video1_01: Several days ago, the sun simply came to a stop in the sky, though during these long winter days, none of us can be certain how long it has been this way.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video1_02: Some of the men in the caravan have taken it as a dire omen. I am not quick to superstition, but I myself will be glad to be done with this year's rounds.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video1_03: We have been warned by stranded travelers about brigands on the path through Ridgehorn, our road home.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video1_04: Our captain seems unconcerned. Perhaps he is as eager as I to be done here. We will rest here this day and inquire further when we speak to the governor.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_00: Like a rabid wolf, that one.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_01: How did it come to this? We fool ourselves believing that peace will last. My grandfather built all this from a poor fishing village, you know.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_02: He watched the gods die. Watched the chaos that followed. Watched man and varl slaughter each other, even before the dredge arose.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_03: All we've done is traded one struggle for another. Now that there are no more dredge to war against, we war against ourselves.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_04: This chieftain meant to kill me, and he's not the first. A dozen families in the city would gladly take my chair.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_05: This one had men waylaying merchants both north and south of the city, strangling trade; quite well I would add, though he denied it to his last. This sort of wolf doesn't stop biting because the head is cut off, it just grows a new head.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_06: I am in a bad way, my friend. Help me finish this fight and I will gladly send you on your way, with double our king's tithe.
SUBTITLE.tutorial_intro_video2_07: Take any men you need. They're loyal, I promise you that. They will meet you down in the proving grounds.
SUBTITLE.vo_08_godstone_aselei_00: Carved rock on a vacant island.
SUBTITLE.vo_08_ormsdalr_00: It's hard to believe we made it across that chasm.
SUBTITLE.vo_08_ormsdalr_01: Now we find whats left of Ormsdalr,
SUBTITLE.vo_08_ormsdalr_02: once a great trade town at the fork of the Ormsa River.
SUBTITLE.vo_08_ormsdalr_03: How many lives must have been lost here?
SUBTITLE.vo_09_bindal_00: The miners of Bindal are a rough crowd.
SUBTITLE.vo_09_bindal_01: Not a bad place to recruit new blades.
SUBTITLE.vo_09_godstone_irynx_00: Wouldn't mind seeing Irynx fly, if only once more
SUBTITLE.vo_10_godstone_baldringr_00: Baldringrs flame welcomes endless war...but why?
SUBTITLE.vo_10_grundar_00: Grundar almost looks forgotten by the rest of the world.
SUBTITLE.vo_10_grundar_02: have forgotten the rest of us too.
SUBTITLE.vo_10_lundar_01: home to the finest fletchers in the world -
SUBTITLE.vo_10_lundar_02: though it appears beset with war.
SUBTITLE.vo_11_cavetown_00: I've slept in caves like this for entire winters,
SUBTITLE.vo_11_cavetown_01: but there's something about this place.
SUBTITLE.vo_11_cavetown_04: But I don't like all these humans
SUBTITLE.vo_11_cavetown_05: on the verge of panic either.
SUBTITLE.vo_11_cavetown_06: Maybe these dwellings up ahead will calm them down.
SUBTITLE.vo_12_fiskivik_00: There are signs of recent fighting all around Fiskivik,
SUBTITLE.vo_12_fiskivik_01: but it might provide a meeting ground
SUBTITLE.vo_12_fiskivik_02: for all who scattered when the Serpent struck.
SUBTITLE.vo_12_godstone_geirradr_00: Geirrar's godstone is in the shadows ahead.
SUBTITLE.vo_12_godstone_geirradr_01: His guidance would be a welcome gift.
SUBTITLE.vo_13_bolverk_dream_00: "Darkness. Lightning. Purple lightning and a...a white tower. Someone pulling the energy from a...dark sun. Who am I? What in the depths is this?"
SUBTITLE.vo_13_godstone_bygglaerer_00: I always respected Bygglaerer the Builder,
SUBTITLE.vo_13_godstone_bygglaerer_01: but if he made those caves we went through, I'll...
SUBTITLE.vo_13_godstone_bygglaerer_02: well, Id have killed him myself.
SUBTITLE.vo_13_oldford_00: Gods. Of all the places to make a final stand,
SUBTITLE.vo_13_oldford_01: I bring us to the Old Ford - a human bridge
SUBTITLE.vo_13_oldford_02: that should've crumbled a hundred years ago.
SUBTITLE.vo_14_arberrang_01: But why are so many camped outside the walls?
SUBTITLE.vo_14_arberrang_02: They must have seen the Darkness approaching.
SUBTITLE.vo_14_godstone_lauga_00: They say the moon and stars are always visible
SUBTITLE.vo_14_godstone_lauga_01: when you look at Lauga's godstone.
SUBTITLE.vo_boersgard_00: As we pass steep cliffs, the sprawl of Boersgard comes into view. A city of contrasting rich and poor, opportunity and gamble. Our best hope for salvation, or our graves.
SUBTITLE.vo_cin_bolverkdream3_03: What in the depths is this?!
SUBTITLE.vo_einartoft_00: We approach a city that only varl have seen and cross a bridge that only varl could build. Let us hope that we are the only unwelcome visitors to pass.
SUBTITLE.vo_frostvellr_00: Once a strong, thriving city, the walls of Frostvellr now just keep the howling winds at bay. With luck, they'll hold out against dredge as well.
SUBTITLE.vo_grofheim_00: Dread grips me as we approach Grofheim. None of us expected to see a city unscathed. But what we find steals the very breath from my lungs.
SUBTITLE.vo_reynivik_00: Reynivik is more of a smattering of farm houses than a proper town, though judging by stray dredge stalking through empty fields it is barely even that anymore.
SUBTITLE.vo_sigrholm_00: As Sigrholm approaches we fear the worst. The once calm lake surrounding it now looks like a bowl that has been flipped, proud homes sinking into muddy water. A side effect of the quake...
SUBTITLE.vo_sigrholm_01: What has the rest of the world become on the other side of those mountains?
SUBTITLE.vo_skogr_00: I never expected to see the dredge with my own eyes. What happened in the north?
SUBTITLE.vo_skogr_01: Already we see more between the trees as we approach our home, and Alette grips my hand tight. We must find Iver.
SUBTITLE.vo_vedrfell_00: Vedrfell. Even the name means bad weather, where frozen wind sweeps in from the bay.
SUBTITLE.vo_vedrfell_01: They tend livestock, but most are just men driven from Strand, with nowhere else to go. Why else would anyone stay? We won't stop long.
SUBTITLE.vo_wyrmtoe_00: Wyrmtoe was never the kind of place someone would build a town... fittingly the varl living here aren't known for welcoming visitors with open arms.

TALENT.tal_abk_0_desc:
You search for their broken straps
or torn mail and then make them pay.
TALENT.tal_abk_1_desc:
A small twist can turn a crushing
blow into a scuff on your armor.
TALENT.tal_arm_0_desc:
Bracing at the right time can
ruin an enemy's plans to weaken you.
TALENT.tal_arm_1_desc:
Armor works better when you get
it back where it belongs.
TALENT.tal_exe_0_desc:
Long lives generally belong to the
fighters with the fewest scars.
TALENT.tal_exe_1_desc:
The god Denglr might be dead, but only
luck explains some of these hits.
TALENT.tal_str_0_desc:
Years of toil in field and battle
have hardened your body against pain.
TALENT.tal_str_1_desc:
'Go for the soft spots' as your
trainer is fond of saying.
TALENT.tal_wil_0_desc:
With nothing left to lose, you'll
hang on as long as you can.
TALENT.tal_wil_1_desc:
Some give it their all.
You refuse to accept that limit.

TAUNT.taunt_1: claims to have sired nine wolves on you
TAUNT.taunt_10: believes you need to be taught a lesson
TAUNT.taunt_11: says your warriors are weak-knee'd in the field
TAUNT.taunt_12: can't stand the sight of your face
TAUNT.taunt_13: gently reminds you of your recent crushing defeat
TAUNT.taunt_14: claims to be more afraid of his wife than you
TAUNT.taunt_15: accuses you of weeping when all alone
TAUNT.taunt_17: doesn't even expect you to show up for this match
TAUNT.taunt_18: has raided your farm and made off with 12 goats
TAUNT.taunt_19: believes you are not ready to play with grown-ups yet
TAUNT.taunt_2: has a grudge to settle with you
TAUNT.taunt_20: offers to kiss your spouse when you dont return
TAUNT.taunt_21: insists he did lewd things to you in your sleep
TAUNT.taunt_22: suspects you've actually been a child this whole time
TAUNT.taunt_24: thinks your mother has a goat face and smells of troll
TAUNT.taunt_25: calls you out for your cowardice
TAUNT.taunt_28: implies that your sons will most likely become artists
TAUNT.taunt_3: insists that you owe a fortune in cows
TAUNT.taunt_30: blames a disease on an incident with your grandmother
TAUNT.taunt_31: whispers that you need not be ashamed of utter defeat
TAUNT.taunt_32: thinks you spend too much time on the practice fields
TAUNT.taunt_33: takes "not now" as a sign of impotence
TAUNT.taunt_35: doesn't really care whether you feel like fighting or not
TAUNT.taunt_36: recalls a long history of soiling your lineage
TAUNT.taunt_37: did not enjoy your wife's cooking in the least
TAUNT.taunt_38: wants to know if that's all you've got
TAUNT.taunt_39: offers to repay his debts with your blood
TAUNT.taunt_4: wonders if you remember that time you soiled yourself
TAUNT.taunt_41: challenges you to a fight to the death
TAUNT.taunt_42: takes your silence as a sign of fear
TAUNT.taunt_44: was too drunk last night to remember the reason for this
TAUNT.taunt_45: likens your valor to that of a wood-fish
TAUNT.taunt_47: calls you a wearer of wolf-skins under the full moon
TAUNT.taunt_48: remembers when you were ridden by a stallion
TAUNT.taunt_5: would like to have a friendly practice session
TAUNT.taunt_6: claims you have drank the last keg of mead
TAUNT.taunt_7: would see your limbs strewn across the field of battle
TAUNT.taunt_8: is slandering your name in the presence of others
TAUNT.taunt_9: humbly requires a training from you

TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_00: You can return to the map at any time during travel by pressing this button.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_01: As you travel through the world, time passes. The number of days passed is shown here. Each time a full day passes, your supplies will be consumed.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_02: Morale drops during continuous travel, and when supplies run low. In order to raise morale, you must camp and allow your caravan to rest.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_03: The number of days worth of remaining supplies is shown here. If the caravan has insufficient supplies, people will begin to starve, and morale will drop.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_04: In order to maintain morale and heal injuries, you must rest in camp. Furthermore, camping provides you with opportunities to increase your battle prowess and converse with your heroes. Click here to camp
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_00:
This is the map of the world.

You can explore it by dragging the mouse to pan, and using the mouse wheel to zoom.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_01_alette:
The location of your caravan is indicated here by Alette's icon.

The caravan recently embarked from Aleo's village and is traveling westward down the Ormsa River.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_01_rook:
The location of your caravan is indicated here by Rook's icon.

The caravan recently embarked from Aleo's village and is traveling westward down the Ormsa River.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_02:
Prior to arriving at Aleo's village, the caravan had hurriedly embarked from Boersgard, in the wake of the devestating siege laid by Bellower and his armies.

Click on Boersgard to find out more about it.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_03:
The caravan is attempting to reach Ormsdalr by river, on the way to Arberrang.

Click on Ormsdalr to find out more about it.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_04:
Reaching Arberrang, the human capital, is the ultimate goal of the caravan. It is hoped that the walls of the ancient city will provide safety against the deepening catastrophe.

Click on Arberrang to learn more.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_05: The world map is covered with many locations, and holds much lore. You can explore the map at any time, clicking on locations for more information.
TUTORIAL.s2_8_tut_map_06: When you are finished researching the world map, click this button to return to travel, or to camp.
TUTORIAL.s2_setup_show_objective_tips_00: Click on an objective marker to see detailed instructions.
TUTORIAL.s2_show_horn_00: This warhorn can be used one time for each kill you make, and grants 1 willpower to the active unit. Each kill adds a star, showing how many times it can be used.
TUTORIAL.s2_tips_aleovillage_market_00: You can acquire additional supplies at this market. Click on the market to see what's available.
TUTORIAL.s2_tips_aleovillage_travel_hud_00: This medallion gives you information about your caravan, including Population, Supplies, Renown, and the number of Days that have passed.
TUTORIAL.s2_tips_aleovillage_travel_hud_01: This banner indicates that you have enough supplies to provision your caravan for ${supply_days} days of resting or travel. A larger population requires more supplies per day to survive.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_heroes_00: At any time you can visit the Heroes Tent to inspect and promote your Heroes.  Click the Heroes tent now.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_leave_00: When you are ready to leave camp, you can do so by clicking Leave.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_rest_00: When a day passes in camp, your caravan consumes a day's worth of supplies, and morale increases. Click the Rest tent now.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_trainfighters_exec_00: The number of clansmen and fighters is shown here. If your caravan is assaulted en masse, in a War situation, it is the fighters that protect the clansmen while your heroes fight a tactical battle.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_trainfighters_exec_01: It is important to keep enough trained fighters available, but keep in mind that fighters consume more supplies than clansmen, and are less effective at foraging.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_trainfighters_exec_02: Speak to Sven in the Training Tent to start training some of your clansmen into battle-ready fighters.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_trainheroes_exec_00: This is the Training tent, where you can hone your skills by completing challenges and through free-form sparring.  Click on the Training tent to begin your first challenge.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_camp_trainheroes_exec_post_00: Check back frequently for more challenge sessions, or spar anytime you like.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_difficulty_00:
You are about to enter a battle. If you find the battles too challenging or difficult, or if you find yourself needing a tougher challenge, you can modify the difficulty settings.

Don't worry!  You can change the difficulty of battles at any time before a battle begins.
TUTORIAL.s2_tut_difficulty_01: To access the difficulty settings, open the options menu.  You can click on this button, or hit the ESCAPE key at almost any time.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_0: Careful of the strong ones, hit them before they hit you!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_1: Maim if you can! A wounded enemy will just slow down his allies!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_10: Watch your spacing, don't block yourself in...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_11: Always think ahead to your next move...a master thinks to their next 7!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_12: The dredge are stronger than you! Out-think them!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_13: Assess how much strength your foes have left, then prey on the strongest!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_14: Don't get surrounded! Keep them in front of you!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_15: Protect your strong by sacrificing the weak...tough decisions need to be made.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_16: You all look sloppy out there, take some time to study your skills in the Heroes Tent!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_17: Don't waste time leaving scratches. When in doubt, break their armor!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_18: Concentrate! Your mind wanders even a little and death will find you!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_19: Don't be afraid to rest if you need it. Can be the difference between life and death.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_2: A weakened foe is often better than a dead one!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_20: I've got better things to do with my time if you're not going to make an effort!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_21: Use your abilities in unison...the sum is greater than its parts!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_22: Use your battle horn if you're feeling exhausted.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_23: Not all dredge are the same. Pay close attention to what they can do.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_24: Assemble yourselves in the order you plan to attack BEFORE the battle!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_25: After this session someone needs to get me a drink.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_26: Never give up, fight every battle to the bitter end!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_27: Learn to master your abilities, but more importantly understand your enemies...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_28: Watch the archers...the more damaged your armor, the deeper their arrows go.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_3: Judge your enemies movement and stay out of reach!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_4: Weaken the strongest, the rest will follow...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_5: Don't focus on one at a time! Whittle them all down!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_6: Mind your formation, a force united is hard to withstand!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_7: Don't try to rely on brute force alone! Break their armor!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_8: Which opponent is next to act? Strike them first!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_9: Block their movement, shield wielders to the front!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_arc_lightning: Gods, Eyvind. Try not to burn the tent down.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_batteringram: Smash enemies through their allies or push friends into a better position to attack!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_birdofprey: No need to move forward. Stay safe and fire from a distance!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_bloodyflail: Form up on an ally BEFORE you bloody that axe, you'll do more damage!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_bringthepain: Concentrate! Let them tire out on your shield and then hit them where it hurts!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_forgeahead: Wish they'd start listening to me like that, Krumr!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_impale: If you're going to impale them take advantage of it! The more they move, the more they'll bleed...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_malice: You start taking a provoker seriously, he's going to get the best of you.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_markprey: Rook's got a keen eye. Follow his lead!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_mend: A more useful skill on the battlefield I have not seen! Keep your will strong.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_rainofarrows: Well done, girl! Concentrate, don't move before shooting and you can puncture armor as well!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_rally: Keep an eye on the ones who can use it the most. Act right before they do!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_runthrough: Go after the ones in the back! One good hit will cripple them!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_slagandburn: Even if you can't reach them, leave a path of fire for them to walk over!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_stonewall: Get in their way! That shield's going to save your friend's lives!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_sunderingimpact: Dundr's mug! Hit them THAT hard and their children will feel it!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_tempest: Don't swing so recklessly, you'll injure an ally!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_abl_threadtheneedle: Line them up, Alette, but take care not to tag allies unless they can take the hit.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_embolden: Everyone take note! The tide is turning!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_heavyimpact: Hit them hard enough and their friends will feel it!
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_light_step: Like passing through trees in a forest...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_puncture: Skillfully done, lass! Don't move, take careful aim and pick the spots where the armor lacks...
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_returnthefavor: If you can take a hit you can return one.
TUTORIAL.trn_tip_pas_shieldwall: Shields together! Raiders in formation become defensive walls!
TUTORIAL.tut_attack_mode_gp: Enemy tiles are red, and pulse if the enemy is in range.  To target a nearby enemy, use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> to select the Attack icon, then press <<GP.A>> to target the enemy.
TUTORIAL.tut_attack_target_mode:
To target an enemy, click the tile on which they stand. 
Ally tiles are blue; the enemy's are red. 
Target this enemy now by clicking his tile.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_confirm_mode:
This enemy has only 5 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> remaining.
A <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> attack will kill him. 

Click the <font color='#ff0000'>fist</font> now to attack his <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, then <font color='#00ff00'>Confirm</font> your choice.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_confirm_mode_gp:
This enemy has only 5 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> remaining.
A <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> attack will kill him. 

Use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to select the <font color='#ff0000'>fist</font> to attack <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, then press <<GP.A>> to confirm.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_killed_renown_mode:
He's down! Each time you make a kill your Renown grows,
which is used later to improve your characters.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_stats_arm_mode:
<font color='#128fff'>Armor</font> blocks strength damage, but can
be reduced by a break attack.

By breaking <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font> you open them up to
take more damage in the future.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_stats_str_mode:
<font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> counts as both health AND 
damage. A loss of 2 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, means you'll
now do 2 less damage. 
If <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> falls to zero, the character 
falls in battle.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_attack_type_mode:
You can choose to either attack the enemy's <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> 
or break his <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font>. The numbers beneath each icon (2,5)
show the damage you will do to that stat.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_chieftain_attack_pre_mode:
Despite being at full <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, the Chieftain
will do little damage against your Shieldbanger's
high <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font>.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_chieftain_rest_pre_mode:
If a character does not move on his turn,
he can rest to regain 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font>.

The Chieftain will rest this turn.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_click_chieftain_mode:
Looks like the Chieftain is in some trouble.
Your Shieldbanger won't be able to finish the job with
a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost
your damage. Click the Chieftain's tile to attack!.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_click_chieftain_mode_gp:
Looks like the Chieftain is in some trouble.
Your Shieldbanger won't be able to finish the job with
a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost
your damage. Use <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to begin the attack!.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_initiative_mode:
These portraits show the order of initiative, taking turns from left to right. 
Your allies are blue; the enemy is red. 
It's your turn to act!
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_intro_mode:
You've arrived just in time. The Chieftain in red and his men
are now looking at a tougher fight than they bargained for.

Drag around the screen to see your surroundings.
Click the <font color='#00ff00'>check mark</font> to continue.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_intro_mode_gp:
You've arrived just in time. The Chieftain in red and his men
are now looking at a tougher fight than they bargained for.

Use Right Stick <<GP.RSTICK>> to pan around your surroundings.
Press Right Stick Button <<GP.R3>> + <<GP.RSTICK>> to zoom.
Press <<GP.A>> to continue.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_move_start_mode:
Movement happens before action. 

This ring shows your Shieldbanger is active. 
The blue tiles around him show where he can move.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_move_tiles_mode:
Some characters fill more tiles than others.

The horned allies are a race of giants called
Varl who take up 4 tiles each, while humans fill a single
tile. This can have a huge impact on your strategy.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_next_initiative_mode:
After taking an action your turn ends.
Next up is the enemy. Turns always alternate,
even if you are outnumbered.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_pillage_mode:
That made quick work of the Chieftain's bodyguards! When there is only
one enemy left, players enter Pillage mode.

During Pillage, each character moves in order, and there are no more
guaranteed turns. Check the initiative to see how the order has changed.
Your allies now get to move twice in a row.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_popup_chieftain_mode:
Click the fist, and then the stars above the fist to add willpower. The
number of stars available each turn are determined by your <font color='#00ff00'>Exertion</font> stat.

You'll see the damage number go up as you add willpower. Click a star
and then the green check mark to kill this enemy!
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_popup_chieftain_mode_gp:
<<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to select the fist, then press <<GP.R1>> to add a star to the attack.
The number of stars available each turn are determined by your <font color='#00ff00'>Exertion</font> stat.
You'll see the damage number go up as you add willpower. Add the star and <<GP.A>> to kill this enemy!
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_rook_alette_attack:
The orange squares indicate the range of the unit's attack.
Archers like Rook and Alette have a much longer range than melee units.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_rook_alette_deploy:
Deployment happens before battle. Click your units (Rook and Alette)
to deploy them within the blue squares. Click 'Ready' to start the battle.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_rook_alette_portrait: Click a unit's portrait to see information about their abilities.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_horn:
Whenever an enemy falls in battle, 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower star</font> is added to your Horn.
Using the Horn will give 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> to the active ally.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_ludin_waypoint_1:
Clicking any tile will automatically make a path, but you can also set waypoints. 
Click once to make a waypoint.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_ludin_waypoint_1_gp:
Pressing <<GP.A>> on any tile will automatically make a path, but you can also set waypoints. 
Press <<GP.X>> here to make a waypoint.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_ludin_waypoint_2:
Now select the next waypoint. 
This is often useful when you need to avoid certain tiles.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_ludin_waypoint_2_gp:
Waypoint pathing is useful when you need to avoid certain tiles.
Press <<GP.A>> here to finish moving.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_statbanner_gp:
Spearmen can attack diagonally and up to two tiles away.
Press D-Pad Up <<GP.D_U>> to compare your stats with the enemy's.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_str_attack:
<font color='#128fff'>Armor</font> blocks attacks on <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>.
For each enemy armor higher than your strength, there is a 10% chance the attack will be deflected. Notice the chance to hit shown above the attack button. Attack this enemy's <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>!
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_str_attacked:
Deflected attacks do no damage.
From here on out you will fail catastrophically if you don't break <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font>. 
Damaging both <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> and <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font> is EQUALLY important.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_target_enemy:
Spearmen can attack diagonally and up to two tiles away.
Click the top right banner to compare your stats with the enemy's.
Now click the enemy to target.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_vedrfell_target_enemy_gp: Target this enemy with an Attack using <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_move_click_mode:
By clicking on <font color='#ffff00'>gold tiles</font>, a character can move further than usual,
at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> per gold tile
Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close
you'll have to get to be in range.
Move your Warhawk into attack range, now.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_move_click_mode_gp:
By moving on <font color='#ffff00'>gold tiles</font>, a unit can move further than usual, at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> per gold tile. Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close you'll have to get to be in range.
Move your Warhawk into attack range using <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_self_popup_mode:
Clicking your character's tile will bring up all of his combat
options, including <font color='#00ff00'>Move</font>, <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font>, <font color='#ff0000'>Attack</font>, and <font color='#ffff00'>End Turn</font>.

Click the purple <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> icon now.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_self_popup_mode_gp:
Your unit menu combat options include <font color='#00ff00'>Move</font>, <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font>, <font color='#ff0000'>Attack</font>, and <font color='#ffff00'>End Turn</font>.

Use <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to activate the purple <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> icon now.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_special_click_mode:
Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but your Warhawk 
has a <font color='#d500f8'>Special Ability</font> that gives him a unique advantage. 

Click your Warhawk's tile to access his <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font>.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_special_click_mode_gp:
Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but your Warhawk 
has a <font color='#d500f8'>Special Ability</font> that gives him a unique advantage.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_tempest_target_mode:
The <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> description appears in the tooltips below. The Warhawk's <font color='#d500f8'>Tempest</font> allows him to slam multiple enemies at once.
Select an enemy and then <font color='#00ff00'>Confirm</font> your choice.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_tempest_target_mode_g:
The <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> description appears in the tooltips below. The Warhawk's <font color='#d500f8'>Tempest</font> allows him to slam multiple enemies at once.
Use <<GP.D_LR>> to select an enemy and then <font color='#00ff00'>Confirm</font> your choice with <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL.tut_battle_warrior_willpower_mode:
Now it's your Warhawk's turn. He appears to be out of range of these
enemies, but all characters can use <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> to boost their actions.

<font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> is a limited resource, so use it wisely.
TUTORIAL.tut_heroes_ability: Click on the ability button to learn about the unit's abilities.
TUTORIAL.tut_heroes_details: Click on a unit to view stats, promote ranks, and learn about abilities.
TUTORIAL.tut_heroes_points:
This unit has points available to spend on improving stats and talents.
Activate one of the '+' buttons, above.
TUTORIAL.tut_heroes_talent:
This stat is maxed out, and a talent can now be unlocked.
Activate this stat button to select one of the available talents.
TUTORIAL.tut_meadhouse_hire_mode:
New recruits need to get 5 kills before they can
promote, but experienced characters come with those
kills already achieved.

The red banner by the hire button shows the Renown
cost to hire this experienced Raider character.
Click <font color='#85A95E'>hire</font> now.
TUTORIAL.tut_meadhouse_intro_mode:
The mead house is where you can hire new recruits
and improve them through battle. The arrow buttons
above cycle through available recruits.

Hiring new characters costs Renown.
TUTORIAL.tut_meadhouse_pg_mode:
The Raider will be waiting for you in the proving
grounds. Click the Proving Grounds button to go
there now.
TUTORIAL.tut_meadhouse_renown_mode:
The governor's endorsement has greatly increased your Renown amongst his men.

Renown is the currency used for everything in Factions. Use the Renown
banner or visit the Marketplace in Strand to earn Renown outside of battle.
TUTORIAL.tut_move_click_mode:
Click the tile you want to move to, then 
click the <font color='#00ff00'>check mark</font> to <font color='#00ff00'>Confirm</font>. 
Move your Shieldbanger here, to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL.tut_move_click_mode_gp:
Use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> to choose a tile, then press <<GP.A>> to confirm the move.
Move your Shieldbanger here, to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_complete_mode:
Captain says you're ready for a real fight now.
Gather your men, tell them to prepare for battle and head out to Strand.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_intro_mode:
The Proving Grounds are where you form your team by
dragging units into the top slots. The governor has already
sent more characters to fill out your ranks.

Additional recruits appear below the active team, in the roster.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_name_mode:
Hit Accept to name your character.

You can change a character's name at any time
by returning to his Lore page
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_party_mode:
Let's take a closer look at our experienced Raider.

Click on his portrait now.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_promote_confirm_mode:
The arrows at the top let you cycle through the available
advanced classes, each with their own unique ability.

The red Renown banner next to confirm shows how
much it will cost to promote this character. Press the
<font color='#00ff00'>confirm</font> button to choose this Thrasher.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_promote_mode:
Each character in the Proving Grounds can be customized,
upgraded and promoted to create a powerful team.

When your character has made enough kills in combat he
can be promoted to an advanced class. Our experienced
Raider already has these kills. Click promote now.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_stats_mode:
Advanced classes can also modify their stats for armor,
strength, willpower, exertion and break

Click the ? button to review how each stat works. These
buttons can be found on almost every page.
TUTORIAL.tut_pg_variation_mode:
Select the first variation.

Rare versions cost renown or can be purchased
in the marketplace. You can change a character's
appearance at any time by returning to his Lore page
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_active:
Movement happens before action. 

This ring shows that Iver is active. 
The blue tiles around him show where he can move.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_aleo_bark_1: Move away from those glowing rocks!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_aleo_bark_2: No. No! To the depths with you!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_aleo_rest:
If a character does not move on his turn, he can <font color='#ffff00'>rest</font> to regain 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font>.
Aleo will <font color='#ffff00'>rest</font> this turn.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_alette_bark_1: We'll handle the rest. Pull back!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_alette_turn: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Alette won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost her damage. Click the Dredge Grunt's tile to attack!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_alette_turn_gp: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Alette won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost her damage. Use <<GP.LSTICK>>, <<GP.A>>, and <<GP.D_LR>> to target the Dredge Grunt.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_armor: <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font> blocks <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> damage, but can be reduced by a break attack. By breaking <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font>, you open them up to take more damage in the future.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_attack: You can choose to either attack the enemys <font color = '#ff0000'>Strength</font> or break his <font color='#128fff'>Armor</font>. The numbers beneath each icon (2, 8) show the damage you will do to that stat.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_drag:
Drag around the screen to see your surroundings.
Click the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to continue.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_drag_gp:
Use Right Stick <<GP.RSTICK>> to pan around your surroundings.
Press Right Stick Button <<GP.R3>> + <<GP.RSTICK>> to zoom.
Press <<GP.A>> to continue.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_grunt_smash: Without an enemy to reach, this Dredge Grunt will choose to smash an obstacle in his way. Obstacles on the combat board will make you change tactics, so plan wisely to make them work to your benefit.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_ability: Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but Hakon has a special Ability that gives him a unique advantage. Click Hakons purple ability icon to access his <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> now.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_ability_2: The <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> description appears in the tooltips below. Hakons <font color='#d500f8'>Sundering Impact</font> allows him to hit so hard that multiple adjacent tiles take damage on every hit!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_ability_gp:
Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but Hakon 
has a <font color='#d500f8'>Special Ability</font> that gives him a unique advantage.

Use <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to activate the purple <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> icon now.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_bark_1: Better to let him keep fighting.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_move: By clicking on <font color='#ffff00'>gold tiles</font>, a hero can move further than usual, at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> for each step that includes a gold tile. Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close you'll have to get to be in range. Move Hakon into attack range now.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_move_gp:
By moving on <font color='#ffff00'>gold tiles</font>, a unit can move further than usual, at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> per gold tile. Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close you'll have to get to be in range.
Move Hakon into attack range using <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_sundering: Select the enemys tile and then then <font color='#00CCFF'>confirm</font> your choice to hit them hard with <font color='#d500f8'>Sundering Impact</font>.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_sundering_gp: Use <<GP.D_LR>> to select an enemy and then <font color='#00ff00'>Confirm</font> your choice with <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hakon_turn: Now it's Hakon's turn. He appears to be out of range of these enemies, but all heroes can use <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> to boost their actions. <font color='#ffff00>Willpower</font> is a limited resource, so use it wisely.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hero_attack: Click the <font color='#ff0000'>red</font> fist icon, and then a star above the fist icon to add <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> to the attack. The number of stars available each turn are determined by your <font color='#00ff00'>Exertion</font> stat. Youll see the damage number go up as you add <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font>. Click a star and then the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to kill this enemy.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_hero_attack_gp:
<<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to select the fist, then press <<GP.R1>> to add a star to the attack.
The number of stars available each turn are determined by your <font color='#00ff00'>Exertion</font> stat.
You'll see the damage number go up as you add willpower. Add the star and <<GP.A>> to kill this enemy!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_initiative:
These portraits show the order of initiative, taking turns from left to right. 
Your heroes are blue; the enemy is red. 
It's your turn to act!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_iver_bark_1: Damn it, Rook, quit running ahead!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_kill: This enemy has only 7 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> remaining. A <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> attack will kill it. Click the <font color='#ff0000'>red</font> fist icon now to attack his <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, then <font color='#00CCFF'>confirm</font> your choice.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_kill_gp:
This enemy has only 7 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> remaining.
A <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> attack will kill it. 

Use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>> to select the <font color='#ff0000'>fist</font> to attack <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, then press <<GP.A>> to confirm.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_killed1: He's down! Each time you make a kill your Renown grows, which is used later to improve your characters.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_0: These are the supplies the merchant has available.  He will give you ${market_supplies_per_renown} per renown, and you need ${-supply_burn} supplies per day to survive.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_1: This shows what you have.  Your ${supplies} supplies will last for ${supply_days} days.  You have ${renown} renown available to purchase supplies.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_2: Click this button to add 15 or more supplies to your caravan.  The area to the left will show how these supplies affect your caravan.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_3: Now that you've added your supplies, you must confirm the change by pressing this button.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_4: Markets also have items available.  These items are equipped by your heroes and can provide a great advantage. The required hero rank is shown in the red circles.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_market_5: When finished, exit the market by clicking this button.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_move:
Some heroes fill more tiles than others.

The horned heroes are a race of giants called varl who take up 4 tiles each, while humans fill a single tile. This can have a huge impact on your strategy.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_move_2: Click the tile you want to move to, then click the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to <font color='#00CCFF'>confirm</font>. Move Iver here to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_move_2_gp:
Use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> to choose a tile, then press <<GP.A>> to confirm the move.
Move Iver here, to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_options: Clicking your heros tile at any time will also will bring up all of his combat options, including <font color='#00ff00'>move</font>, <font color='#d500f8'>ability</font>, <font color='#ff0000'>attack</font> and <font color='#ffff00'>end turn</font>.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_pillage: A powerful strike! When there is only one enemy left, heroes enter Pillage mode. During Pillage, each hero moves in order, and there are no more guaranteed turns. Check the initiative to see how the order has changed.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_rook_turn: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Rook won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost his damage. Click the Dredge Grunt's tile to attack!
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_rook_turn_gp: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Rook won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost his damage. Use <<GP.LSTICK>>, <<GP.A>>, and <<GP.D_LR>> to target the Dredge Grunt
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_strength: <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> counts as both health AND damage. A loss of 8 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> means the character will now do 8 less damage. If <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> falls to 0, the character falls in battle.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_target: To target an enemy, click the tile on which they stand. Heroes' tiles are blue; the enemies' are red. Target this enemy now by clicking his tile.
TUTORIAL.tut_s2_target_gp: Enemy tiles are red, and pulse if the enemy is in range.  To target a nearby enemy, use Left Stick <<GP.LSTICK>> to select the Attack icon, then press <<GP.A>> to target the enemy.
TUTORIAL.tut_speak_miss: I need to Break Armor to avoid deflections!
TUTORIAL.tut_tip_miss:
Percentage chance to hit means
Target ARMOR > Your STRENGTH
Break the target's ARMOR first
to avoid deflections.
TUTORIAL.tut_town_end_tutorials_body: Click the button in the upper right to watch tutorial videos which explain miss chance, the horn, how to change character stats and many other topics. You can also replay the tutorial there at any time. And with that, the city is yours to explore. To battle!
TUTORIAL.tut_town_goto_greathall:
The governor is ready for you up in the Great Hall.
There you can find fights all across the city
or join tournaments to test your mettle against the best.

Fight, learn, and prove your worth!
TUTORIAL.tut_town_help_mode:
This is Strand, where you can explore Factions.
Drag to pan around the scene.

The governor asked you to build a team and help defend him
throughout the city. Your best bet is to check the Mead House.
Click the ? button to see all the locations around Strand.
TUTORIAL.tut_town_meadhouse_mode: Now head to the Mead House.

TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_00: You can return to the map at any time during travel by pressing <<GP.Y>> to activate the Travel HUD, and then pressing <<GP.X>> to camp
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_04: In order to maintain morale and heal injuries, you must rest in camp. Furthermore, camping provides you with opportunities to increase your battle prowess and converse with your heroes. Press <<GP.Y>> to activate the Travel HUD, and then press <<GP.A>> to camp
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_00:
This is the map of the world.

You can explore by panning with <<GP.RSTICK>> and zooming with <<GP.L2>> and <<GP.R2>>.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_02:
Prior to arriving at Aleo's village, the caravan had hurriedly embarked from Boersgard, in the wake of the devestating siege laid by Bellower and his armies.

Select Boersgard with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> to find out more about it.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_03:
The caravan is attempting to reach Ormsdalr by river, on the way to Arberrang.

Select Ormsdalr with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> to find out more about it.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_04:
Reaching Arberrang, the human capital, is the ultimate goal of the caravan. It is hoped that the walls of the ancient city will provide safety against the deepening catastrophe.

Select Arberrang with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> to learn more.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_05: The world map is covered with many locations, and holds much lore. You can explore the map at any time, selecting locations with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> for more information.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_8_tut_map_06: When you are finished researching the world map, press <<GP.B>> to return to travel, or to camp.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_setup_show_objective_tips_00: Use <<GP.START>> to open the options menu and select 'Battle Objectives' to get detailed instructions about the objectives.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tips_aleovillage_market_00: You can acquire additional supplies at this market. Select the market with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> to see what's available.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_heroes_00: At any time you can visit the Heroes Tent to inspect and promote your Heroes.  Select the Heroes tent with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> now.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_leave_00: When you are ready to leave camp, select Leave with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_rest_00: When a day passes in camp, your caravan consumes a day's worth of supplies, and morale increases. Select the Rest tent with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> now.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tut_camp_trainheroes_exec_00: This is the Training tent, where you can hone your skills by completing challenges and through free-form sparring.  Select the Training tent with <<GP.L1>>, <<GP.R1>>, or <<GP.LSTICK>>, and press <<GP.A>> to begin your first challenge.
TUTORIAL_GP.s2_tut_difficulty_01: To access the difficulty settings, open the options menu.  Press <<GP.MENU>> to access the options menu at any time.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_battle_rook_alette_attack:
The orange squares indicate the range of the unit's attack.
Archers like Rook and Alette have a much longer range than melee units.
Use <<GP.D_LR>> to target an enemy within attack range.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_battle_rook_alette_deploy: Deployment happens before battle. Select your units (Rook and Alette) with <<GP.D_LR>> and deploy them within the blue squares using <<GP.LSTICK>> and <<GP.A>>. Press <<GP.Y>> to start the battle.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_battle_rook_alette_portrait: Select a unit with <<GP.D_LR>> to see information about their abilities.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_heroes_ability: Use <<GP.DPAD>> and <<GP.A>> to select the ability button to learn about the unit's abilities.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_heroes_details: Use <<GP.DPAD>> and <<GP.A>> to select a unit and view stats, promote ranks, and learn about abilities.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_s2_market_2: Press <<GP.R1>> to add 15 or more supplies to your caravan.  The area to the left will show how these supplies affect your caravan.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_s2_market_3: Now that you've added your supplies, you must confirm the change by pressing <<GP.A>>.
TUTORIAL_GP.tut_s2_market_4: Markets also have items available.  These items are equipped by your heroes and can provide a great advantage. The required hero rank is shown in the red circles. Take a look at the items by pressing <<GP.Y>>

TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_camp_postmap_04: In order to maintain morale and heal injuries, you must rest in camp. Furthermore, camping provides you with opportunities to increase your battle prowess and converse with your heroes. Tap here to camp
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_00:
This is the map of the world.

You can explore it by dragging your finger to pan, and using the pinch gesture to zoom.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_02:
Prior to arriving at Aleo's village, the caravan had hurriedly embarked from Boersgard, in the wake of the devestating siege laid by Bellower and his armies.

TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_03:

TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_04:
Reaching Arberrang, the human capital, is the ultimate goal of the caravan. It is hoped that the walls of the ancient city will provide safety against the deepening catastrophe.

TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_05: The world map is covered with many locations, and holds much lore. You can explore the map at any time, tapping on locations for more information.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_8_tut_map_06: When you are finished researching the world map, tap this button to return to travel, or to camp.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_setup_show_objective_tips_00: Tap an objective marker to see detailed instructions.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tips_aleovillage_market_00: You can acquire additional supplies at this market. Tap the market to see what's available.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_heroes_00: At any time you can visit the Heroes Tent to inspect and promote your Heroes.  Tap the Heroes tent now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_leave_00: When you are ready to leave camp, you can do so by tapping Leave.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tut_camp_ormsdalr_rest_00: When a day passes in camp, your caravan consumes a day's worth of supplies, and morale increases. Tap the Rest tent now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tut_camp_trainheroes_exec_00: This is the Training tent, where you can hone your skills by completing challenges and through free-form sparring.  Tap on the Training tent to begin your first challenge.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.s2_tut_difficulty_01: To access the difficulty settings, open the options menu.  You can tap on this button at almost any time.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_attack_target_mode:
To target an enemy, tap the tile on which they stand. 
Ally tiles are blue; the enemy's are red. 
Target this enemy now by tapping his tile.

TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_battle_rook_alette_portrait: Tap a unit's portrait to see information about their abilities.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_battle_vedrfell_ludin_waypoint_1:
Tapping any tile will automatically make a path, but you can also set waypoints. 
Tap once to make a waypoint.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_battle_vedrfell_target_enemy:
Spearmen can attack diagonally and up to two tiles away.
Tap the top right banner to compare your stats with the enemy's.
Now tap the enemy to target.

at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> per gold tile
Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close
you'll have to get to be in range.

Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but your Warhawk 
has a <font color='#d500f8'>Special Ability</font> that gives him a unique advantage. 

Tap your Warhawk's tile to access his <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font>.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_heroes_ability: Tap on the ability button to learn about the unit's abilities.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_heroes_details: Tap on a unit to view stats, promote ranks, and learn about abilities.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_meadhouse_hire_mode:
New recruits need to get 5 kills before they can
promote, but experienced characters come with those
kills already achieved.

The red banner by the hire button shows the Renown
cost to hire this experienced Raider character.
Tap <font color='#85A95E'>hire</font> now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_meadhouse_pg_mode:
The Raider will be waiting for you in the proving
grounds. Tap the Proving Grounds button to go
there now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_move_click_mode:
Tap the tile you want to move to, then 
tap the <font color='#00ff00'>check mark</font> to <font color='#00CCFF'>Confirm</font>. 
Move your Shieldbanger here, to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_pg_party_mode:
Let's take a closer look at our experienced Raider.

Tap on his portrait now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_pg_promote_mode:
Each character in the Proving Grounds can be customized,
upgraded and promoted to create a powerful team.

When your character has made enough kills in combat he
can be promoted to an advanced class. Our experienced
Raider already has these kills. Tap promote now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_pg_stats_mode:
Advanced classes can also modify their stats for armor,
strength, willpower, exertion and break

Tap the ? button to review how each stat works. These
buttons can be found on almost every page.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_alette_turn: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Alette won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost her damage. Tap the Dredge Grunt's tile to attack!
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_drag:
Drag around the screen to see your surroundings.
Tap the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to continue.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_hakon_ability: Standard attacks only affect a single enemy, but Hakon has a special Ability that gives him a unique advantage. Tap Hakons purple ability icon to access his <font color='#d500f8'>Ability</font> now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_hakon_move: By tapping on <font color='#ffff00'>gold tiles</font>, a hero can move further than usual, at the cost of 1 <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> for each step that includes a gold tile. Red, pulsing tiles beneath your enemy show how close you'll have to get to be in range. Move Hakon into attack range now.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_hero_attack: Tap the <font color='#ff0000'>red</font> fist icon, and then a star above the fist icon to add <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> to the attack. The number of stars available each turn are determined by your <font color='#00ff00'>Exertion</font> stat. Youll see the damage number go up as you add <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font>. Tap a star and then the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to kill this enemy.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_kill: This enemy has only 7 <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> remaining. A <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font> attack will kill it. Tap the <font color='#ff0000'>red</font> fist icon now to attack his <font color='#ff0000'>Strength</font>, then <font color='#00CCFF'>confirm</font> your choice.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_market_2: Tap this button to add 15 or more supplies to your caravan.  The area to the left will show how these supplies affect your caravan.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_market_5: When finished, exit the market by tapping this button.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_move_2: Tap the tile you want to move to, then tap the <font color='#00CCFF'>checkmark</font> to <font color='#00CCFF'>confirm</font>. Move Iver here to get him into attack range.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_options: Tapping your heros tile at any time will also will bring up all of his combat options, including <font color='#00ff00'>move</font>, <font color='#d500f8'>ability</font>, <font color='#ff0000'>attack</font> and <font color='#ffff00'>end turn</font>.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_rook_turn: Looks like the dredge is in some trouble. Rook won't be able to finish the job with a normal attack, but <font color='#ffff00'>Willpower</font> can be used to boost his damage. Tap the Dredge Grunt's tile to attack!
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_s2_target: To target an enemy, tap the tile on which they stand. Heroes' tiles are blue; the enemies' are red. Target this enemy now by tapping his tile.
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_town_end_tutorials_body: Tap the button in the upper right to watch tutorial videos which explain miss chance, the horn, how to change character stats and many other topics. You can also replay the tutorial there at any time. And with that, the city is yours to explore. To battle!
TUTORIAL_MOBILE.tut_town_help_mode:
This is Strand, where you can explore Factions.
Drag to pan around the scene.

The governor asked you to build a team and help defend him
throughout the city. Your best bet is to check the Mead House.
Tap the ? button to see all the locations around Strand.
